headline: DevOps
description.text:
DevOps Engineer - Amaris Consulting, Gothenburg
Amaris Consulting is seeking a skilled DevOps Engineer to join our team in Gothenburg. We are a global consulting firm providing services to clients in various industries, including automotive, telecom, pharma, railway, tech, and defense. We are looking for someone who can help us develop and maintain our clients technology infrastructure.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies
Automate deployment processes and monitor systems to ensure high availability and reliability
Collaborate with development and operations teams to resolve issues and optimize systems
Stay current with emerging trends and technologies in DevOps and cloud computing

Requirements:
Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and Terraform
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and experience using tools such as Jenkins and Zuul
Excellent communication and collaboration skills

What we offer:
A challenging and dynamic work environment with our clients 
The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and global firms

Meritious if you: 
Previous and relevant experience in aforementioned industries 
Previous experience from working in embedded environment with C, C++ ,C# 
Leadership roles or responsibilities
Any experience and proof of excellent abilities and achievements. 
You have an updated github portfolio with past projects you worked with.



If you are passionate about DevOps and want to be part of a fast-growing global consulting firm, we want to hear from you! For any questions please contact aleimo@amaris.com

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
DevOps Engineer
Are you in the beginning of your career or want to develop your DevOps skills?
We are a close team of five that have vast experience of both implementing and hosting modern services and platforms towards our customers within Stena. We have a lot of interesting ongoing projects and the time has come to grow our team to further future-proof our delivery!

We offer
A role where you, by collaborating with other fields of expertise and by utilizing cutting-edge technology, work to reach our goal - deliver first class solutions to our internal customers within the Stena AB family.

As a DevOps Engineer at Stena, you will work in close collaboration with development teams and actively support them in their use of our development tooling, utilizing best practices, on-boarding and troubleshooting as well as managing our Container Platforms.

You will work with technologies such as OpenShift, Kubernetes, Linux, and with various CI/CD Implementations including Azure DevOps. In other words, this is a diverse role and an opportunity to develop yourself in different areas of expertise.

About you
We are looking for someone who takes initiative and is eager to learn, develop their DevOps skills and appreciate complex problem solving. You are open and friendly and appreciate to work in a small group while at the same time working and collaborating with a wide range of IT colleagues and Stena business areas.

To suit for this role we see that you either have experience or have a genuine interest in working with Kubernetes or Containers workloads. It would be awesome if you have hands-on experience with software development or automated CI/CD deployment as well as Linux system skills and practical experience operating them in a virtual and/or a cloud environment.

These skills are an advantage but not a criteria to apply for the role, as long as you have an interest of container-based architecture and infrastructure solutions and from troubleshooting in such environments.

Being fluent in Swedish & English is mandatory.

About us
We are a team with passion for DevOps methodologies and application hosting environments.

Our main focus is to provide enterprise Grade application platforms to meet requirements for modern development and infrastructure. We also help development teams to implement and work according to the DevOps methodology to enable unified ways of working, supporting secure systems and fast delivery.

Stena Group IT is a part of Stena AB and we serve the whole Stena AB group with IT solutions, supporting everything from real estate and shipping, to finance and new business.



Questions
Regarding the role: Anders Josefsson, anders.josefsson@stena.com
Regarding the process: Julia Frid√©n, julia.friden@stena.com

We will handle applications on ongoing basis, therefore send your application today or at the latest 2nd of April.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Beyond Tech AB is looking for a DevOps Engineer who will be responsible for the design, development, testing, and deployment of products that help companies communicate with their customers in deep and personal ways.
What you will do:
Deploy and maintain critical applications on cloud-native microservices architecture
Implement automation, effective monitoring, and infrastructure-as-code
Deploy and maintain CI/CD pipelines across multiple environments
Support and work alongside a cross-functional engineering team on the latest technologies
Iterate on best practices to increase the quality & velocity of deployments
Sustain and improve the process of knowledge sharing throughout the engineering team
Have on call responsibilities in rotation with the engineering team

What will help you succeed in this role:
Experience maintaining and deploying highly-available, fault-tolerant systems at scale
A drive towards automating repetitive tasks (e.g. scripting via Bash, Python, Ruby, etc)
Practical experience with Docker containerization and clustering (Kubernetes/ECS)
Expertise with AWS (e.g. IAM, EC2, VPC, ELB, ALB, Autoscaling, Lambda)
Version control system experience (e.g. Git)
Experience implementing CI/CD (e.g. Jenkins, TravisCI)
Operational (e.g. HA/Backups) NoSQL experience (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis)
Experience with configuration management tools (e.g. Ansible, Chef)
Experience with infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform, Cloudformation)
Bachelor or master's degree in CS, or equivalent practical experience
Effective communication skills

If you think that you are fit, please apply. If you have any questions, please reach out to hima@beyondtech.se

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Are you a DevOps Engineer with a passion for infrastructure and cloud? If you are comfortable working in an international, dynamic and fast-growing SaaS environment and appreciate Benify's core values of showing love, thinking ahead and exceeding expectations, then you may be the person we are looking for! In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to influence the development of a solid product with a set of core features for multiple markets!

Benify is an international HR technology company that provides a market leading global benefits and total rewards platform. With over 500 Benifyers in 6 countries, we are successful with over 1500 customers and approximately two million users worldwide. We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included. Help us make people's lives easier and more beneficial! üåç

About the role

We are on an exciting growth journey, which means we are entering new markets internationally. At the same time, we are on an exciting architectural journey and would love your help in further developing our infrastructure. We are continuously implementing new technologies.

In the role of DevOps Engineer (m/f), you will work according to DevOps principles to manage Benify's FPS environments with the associated support systems. You will be part of our smaller infrastructure team and work closely with your teammates. This has the advantage of allowing you to collaborate with the entire DevOps area and be able to learn new and exciting things. You will have great development opportunities and report to the Head of Infrastructure.

What you will do in this position

- Developing our infrastructure platform, both on-prem and on Public cloud

- Research and develop new technologies

- Scripting and building efficient tools, improving CI /CD flows, development environments and working with Kubernetes and monitoring tools

Tools and technologies

- Linux, Terraform, Ansible, GitLab, Kubernetes, Golang, NATS, Service Mesh, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Alibaba Cloud

Personal qualities

As a person, we want someone who is driven and self-propelled. Since the team is smaller, you will have great opportunities to make an impact and we would see you enjoy that and bring new ideas. We have an open culture where everyone is approachable, helpful and friendly - and we believe you share these core values. You are a collaborative individual with an open mind and a willingness to learn.

To be successful in this position, we also expect you to have the following:

- Relevant education, most likely in software engineering/computer science

- A few years of experience as a DevOps Engineer or Software Developer with similar technologies that we use

- Fluency in English

What‚Äôs In It For You?

- Collective agreement üìù

- Generous wellness allowance üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

- 30 days vacation üåû

- ITP1 Pension and Lifeplan - a pension tool that provides you with personalized advice to optimize your retirement planning üí∏

- Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid work model üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶

- Annual conference overseas ‚úàÔ∏è

- A variety of social events and activities in the offices ‚úåÔ∏è

- You're responsible for your own development and we offer internal career opportunities üöÄ

Practical information

Start: As soon as we find our perfect match

Location: Gothenburg

Extent: Full time

Sounds interesting? We interview candidates continuously so don‚Äôt miss your chance - apply today!

headline: Senior DevOps
description.text:
Do you want to create technology for the next generation of industry and society? Univrses is accelerating the development of the 3DAI‚Ñ¢ City platform and we are now looking for a Machine Learning Operations Engineer to join the team in Stockholm.
Univrses is a 3D Computer Vision and Machine Learning company based in Stockholm, creating high-end technologies for autonomous systems. We work in several different areas, but our main focus is on self-driving vehicles, mobile robotics and smart city development. Our team consists of hard-working and friendly people from all over the world.
Your role
As our new Senior DevOps engineer you will play a crucial part in building, deploying and operating the 3DAI‚Ñ¢ City platform. The platform is a scalable answer to the growing demand for data about the urban environment and part of Univrses efforts in smart city development. 
You will take a leading role in defining and implementing MLOps practices for the 3DAI‚Ñ¢ City platform 
You will collaborate closely with Product Owners, Developers and Computer Vision Scientists to ensure reliable delivery to our customers
You will work together with the developers to define and maintain a well working deployment process
You will have great opportunity to create and develop routines and ways of cooperation

Who you are 
You have experience in working and communicating with multiple teams.
You have mastered GNU/Linux systems.
You have experience in building and configuring networks, and server installation or maintenance.
You have strong experience in producing high quality code and developing software with different practices (CI/CD, version control, some variety of agile development)
You are experienced in programming with Python and Bash and can adopt other programming languages. 
You have strong knowledge of AWS cloud platform and technologies (especially S3, Lambdas and SageMaker)
You are familiar with DevOps tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, CloudFormation or Terraform
You have experience with Continuous Integration and Deployment services such as Github Action, Jenkins, Circle CI or others.
You have also DataOps related experience around storage (SQL, Postgres, S3), managing, versioning, visualize big data

Bonus points
Experience in training, versioning, deploying, monitoring and/or maintaining machine learning models
You are familiar with some typical DevOps tools such as KubeFlow, MLFlow, Airflow, or others; some machine learning frameworks, such as Tensorflow and/or PyTorch; some logging tools, such as, Grafana, Prometheus and/or others
You are familiar with Ansible

What we offer
Bright and spacious facilities in the heart of S√∂dermalm, Stockholm
Open and friendly work environment
The best co-workers in the world ‚Äì from all over the world!
Generous employee benefits, such as:
Flexible work hours
5 000 SEK/year in wellness grant
Pension plan
Weekly Lunch and Learns
Possibility to work from home

Next step
Interested in joining Univrses as our new Senior DevOps? Submit your application - All application material must be in English!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
At Tele2 we have a vision to enable a society of unlimited possibilities. We strive for circular economy, innovation, diversity and to protect children online. We are now looking for Devops engineer to join Service activation & Charging Group. 


We are proud that our company is built on the courage and strength to challenge everything that others take for granted. We are driven by an absolute belief that things can always be done better by acting fearlessly and challenging how things can and should be done. We take great pride in our role of delivering customer value by being Reliable, Insight Driven and Collaborative ‚Äì it is called the Tele2 Way. We focus on simplicity in every task we undertake, aim to creating unlimited possibilities beyond‚ÄØexpectations. 


ABOUT THE ROLE 


As a member of the Service Activation & Charging Group under IT Core division, you will be an expert in working with as Devops engineer and working on latest n greatest tech stacks to inspire people and help move tele2 as organization closer to its Vision. 


WHAT WE LOOK FOR 


3-5 years of relevant experience as Devops engineer and working with multiple on-prem and/or Hyper scalers solutions such as AWS, Azure etc. 
Experience in building and maintaining testing, production environments in AWS and have a holistic use of major services offered there. 
Experience working with CICD, Jenkins, Gitlab, Appdynamics, Kibana, elastic or similar software products. 
Experience in debugging performance issues and production incidents and solve them as per SLA‚Äôs 
A person who is willing to wear different hats to solve the various production issues at hand and propose solutions to avoid the repetition of same problems in future. 
Experience working with Ansible, Maven, Python and other scripting languages. 





NICE TO HAVE SKILLS 


Experience in cloud security is a plus. 
Experience in networking design FW‚Äôs, LB‚Äôs etc. 
You are comfortable working with GNU and Linux based systems. 
Experience in Containers, Dockers. 
Good communication skills and not afraid to challenge the status quo.  





A FEW WORDS FROM THE MANAGER 


The Core capability of Service activation & Charging (SAC) is to build, maintain and provide reliable Provisioning services to all BSS stacks of Tele2 SE (Comviq, Tele2) and Tele2 Baltics and provide an integration layer (via REST & SOAP API‚Äôs) to activate end customers in core network. (3G, 4G, 5G and beyond) in a secure manner. 


As a part of Service Activation & Charging group, you had the opportunity to work with latest and greatest technology stacks used in Tele2 and learn along the way while having fun. 


LIFE AT TELE2 


Working at Tele2 will let you work in a creative and flexible work environment. You will be part of a culture where teamwork and inclusion are leading the way forward. Every employee is important for the company‚Äôs success, and you will always have an impact through your work. We provide you with the opportunity to grow and develop through internal paths within the organization. 


ARE WE A MATCH? 


Find out more about life at Tele2 and who we are at tele2.com/career and WeAreTele2 on Instagram and Facebook. Are you interested in knowing more about our work to create a more sustainable future? Read about our social responsibility and green efforts at tele2.com/sustainability.  


This is a permanent role, located at our headquarter in Kista, Stockholm. 


Welcome to submit your application! Selection and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, please apply as soon as possible. 


As a step in the recruitment process, Tele2 performs a background check on final candidates.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
DevOps Engineer - Amaris Consulting, Gothenburg
Amaris Consulting is seeking a skilled DevOps Engineer to join our team in Gothenburg. We are a global consulting firm providing services to clients in various industries, including automotive, telecom, pharma, railway, tech, and defense. We are looking for someone who can help us develop and maintain our clients technology infrastructure.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies
Automate deployment processes and monitor systems to ensure high availability and reliability
Collaborate with development and operations teams to resolve issues and optimize systems
Stay current with emerging trends and technologies in DevOps and cloud computing

Requirements:
Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and Terraform
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and experience using tools such as Jenkins and Zuul
Excellent communication and collaboration skills

What we offer:
A challenging and dynamic work environment with our clients 
The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and global firms

Meritious if you: 
Previous and relevant experience in aforementioned industries 
Previous experience from working in embedded environment with C, C++ ,C# 
Leadership roles or responsibilities
Any experience and proof of excellent abilities and achievements. 
You have an updated github portfolio with past projects you worked with



If you are passionate about DevOps and want to be part of a fast-growing global consulting firm, we want to hear from you! For any questions please contact aleimo@amaris.com

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
You get to work with modern technologies with very low amounts of technical debt. We have embraced containerization, cloud services and modern development methodologies and we know that making our developers happy will make our customers happy. You will get to define, set up, configure and maintain an infrastructure of products and services used by thousands of companies every day together with experienced colleagues. We value security, stability, redundancy and uptime, and you will absolutely feel that what you do matters.


Who you are
As a DevOps Engineer at Oneflow, you have an interest in distributed systems and their scalability. The scalability of the platform applies not only to the performance of the system but to how we can scale the organization. You think of encryption, "defense in depth" concepts and the privacy of our customers data. You will be working with infrastructure development and will both improve existing flows and create new ones as our platform evolves. We see that you have at least a few years of experience working with cloud infrastructure, container orchestration, encryption and information security.


Your background:
Having worked a few years with cloud infrastructure and container orchestration
Experience working with tools such as Terraform and cloud platforms
You have created and maintained Kubernetes clusters, both locally and through cloud offerings such as EKS or GKE
You are familiar with CI/CD pipelines and like to optimize deployment processes
Extensive knowledge in certificate and key management, specifically when used in for example AWS/GCP KMS, Azure Key Vault and (Cloud-)HSM solutions
Comfortable securing high volumes of data



Technologies and concepts to work with:
Kubernetes and Docker
AWS
Terraform (or similar)
CI/CD
Distributed logging, tracing and monitoring
Docker and containerization in general 
KMS / HSM

We also value if you have an interest in any of these areas:
Performance and scalability of distributed systems
MySQL / Elasticsearch / RabbitMQ
An understanding of SaaS product development



Come work with us
We value gender equality and diversity in our organisation and strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we encourage and welcome applicants who are people of colour, LGBTQ+, people with disabilities and those without college degrees. We follow a competence based recruitment process. If you feel the above description seems like a good fit for you - we would love to hear from you! Get in touch to start a journey you won‚Äôt forget!
The recruitment process starts with an interview with Emese from the People & Culture team. After that you will complete a personality- and logic test and prepare an assignment before the interview with Kalle and Fredrik from the Product development team.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
You will be placed to work with assignment at our customer place or in-house. Hunza Konsult AB is a consultancy company based in Stockholm. We are specialized in software design and development of enterprise applications. Hunza Konsult AB is growing and now we are looking for few DevOps Engineers. You will work for our internal projects and also onsite at our customers based in Stockholm.
The Role:
We rapidly turn great ideas into awesome products!
Visionary entrepreneurs and enterprising companies work with us to launch innovative digital products. With our collaborative lean approach, we fulfil the software needs of startups and help them test faster!
Who We Are Looking For?
We are looking for you who want to work as a consultant in interesting customer assignments in one or more cloud technologies. Among other things, you will work with:
¬∑      Design and planning of architecture for cloud solutions
¬∑      Builds CI / CD pipelines
¬∑      DevOps and Continuous Improvement
¬∑      Agile way of working
Your profile
Most likely you are already working with cloud technologies today and have a background as an architect, developer or DevOps. It is plus if you are certified or have a commitment to take relevant certifications in the future. You have deep knowledge and experience in one or more of the following areas:
¬∑      Microsoft Azure
¬∑      AWS
¬∑      Google Cloud
¬∑      OpenShift
As a person, you are service-oriented, always put the customer in focus and strive to find the best solution
Must Have Strengths and Skills
¬∑      Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform
¬∑      Must have demonstrated hand-on experience of DevOps tools Docker/Kubernetes, Terraform.
¬∑      Experience working with Cloud services (Azure or AWS or Google cloud etc.)
¬∑      You feel comfortable with Linux and Unix
¬∑      Shell scripting
Plus To Have
¬∑      DevOps certifications
¬∑      Knowledge and experience of Ansible, Puppet, Golang, Istio, Rancher
¬∑      Knowledge of ELK - Elastic Search, Logstash, Kibana/Grifana etc.
¬∑      Knowledge of Micro-service architecture and Event driven development 
¬∑      Knowledge of message brokers such as Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ or ActiveMQ
¬∑     A degree-level education (or equivalent)
¬∑     Good communication skills and fluent in Swedish/English
Do you have question, please contact us on jobs@hunzaconsulting.se

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Quickspin is an online slot game provider with the pursuit of creating the most thrilling experience ever. We also happen to be really awesome. To continue the success story and support continuous improvement, we‚Äôre now looking for a driven DevOps Engineer to join the team.
About the role
The DevOps Engineer at Quickspin will play an important role in the Technology team, working closely with our SRE‚Äôs and DevOps Engineer.
Together, you will help identify and reduce the technical debt, as well as provide solutions and strategies for current and future problems within technology and business plans. All in all, the teams‚Äô tasks range from high-level tech strategies to hands on development, overseeing our overall development, builds and infrastructure, providing a both driving and supporting role to the Game Studio and Platform team. The DevOps Engineer plays a diverse role in the team but is centered around streamlining our games‚Äô development pipeline and lifecycle by improving the surrounding infrastructure and tools. Focus also might be on Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, development, and maintenance of build system along with the version control system. Here, you get to have an investigative approach towards new tools and trends within DevOps and cloud computing.
Qualifications and experience
Passion for automation & a mindset to automate everything.
Ability to use a wide variety of open-source technologies and cloud services.
Experience with CI/CD Tools (Jenkins is a plus).
Experience working with Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Background in Linux server administration, on premise or in cloud.
Solid understanding of good practice version control, build/release systems & package managers.
Experience with Docker and Container Orchestration Systems (K8s is a plus)
Experience using IAC such as Ansible, Ansible Tower & CloudFormation
A working understanding of coding and scripting (Java, Python, Groovy,
Typescript, Javascript, NodeJS etc.)

We also value
Experience with configuration management.
Experience with any continuous integration or build delivery system.
Evangelist for getting software engineers to adopt CI & relevant automation Techniques.
Ability to develop scripts and automation tools that are used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms.
Interest in researching and analyzing the application of new software development & configuration management methodologies to our current needs.
Being AWS Certified



Who you are and what we offer
We are looking for a person that has the ability to identify and address bottlenecks and to drive internal development projects to help streamline and support our business growth. As a person you are a fast learner, a curious and self-driven colleague that can run projects independently. You understand and embrace good development practices such as code reviews, test automation and you take pride in writing code that is easy to test, read and maintain. We go by the vision of ‚ÄúWe create Awesomeness‚Äù and that goes with everything we do - From creating a great work environment together to making thrilling games. Life at Quickspin simply never gets boring ‚Äì and it won‚Äôt take long until it really feels like home. You will be surrounded by kind, corny, and simply put - awesome people - that are truly passionate about what they do. We are also proud to say that we offer an excellent package, flexible hours and of course, a challenging and rewarding job in one of the fastest growing and most exciting industries there is.
Interested?

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Kom och jobba med oss i v√•rt CoreOps-team p√• Svenska Spel! Vi jobbar i till stor del egenutvecklade system och hanterar ett av v√§rldens mest avancerade spelsystem. Nu beh√∂ver vi f√∂rst√§rka med en ny kollega som vill v√§xa och utvecklas med oss. Ta chansen och s√∂k denna tj√§nst!

Vad kommer du att g√∂ra?

Svenska Spels TX-dom√§n ansvarar f√∂r Svenska Spels transaktionssystem. V√•ra system √§r komplexa och hanterar dagligen miljontals transaktioner vilket st√§ller stora krav p√• kvalitet och prestanda. Dom√§nen best√•r av ca 45 personer i rollerna utvecklare, arkitekter, testare, devops och databasspecialister organiserade i ett antal mindre team.

Som DevOps Engineer blir du en del av CoreOps-teamet d√§r du f√•r m√∂jlighet att jobba med utvecklings-, bygg- och deploymentmilj√∂er f√∂r v√•ra transaktionssystem. Vi arbetar med moderna verktyg och teknik i framkant och ger dig m√∂jlighet att arbeta med nya, sp√§nnande l√∂sningar varje dag.

I rollen jobbar du och utvecklarna n√§ra tillsammans. Du ansvarar f√∂r och assisterar kring releaser av dom√§nens komponenter och levererar dem med √∂vervakning och m√§tv√§rden. Du fungerar som bollplank och support vid behov av ny h√•rdvara, n√§tupps√§ttning och brandv√§ggs√∂ppningar i projekt som teamet deltar i.

√Ñr du den som kommer att g√∂ra det?

Som person √§r du sj√§lvst√§ndig, har en stark analys- och probleml√∂sningsf√∂rm√•ga och trivs allra b√§st som en del av ett sammansvetsat team. Du √§r nyfiken och gillar nya utmaningar, speciellt n√§r det kommer till DevOps.

Du har en bred bakgrund som systemutvecklare, systemtekniker eller integrations- och utvecklingsn√§ra testare. Du har djupa kunskaper och fler√•rig erfarenhet av Linux och har arbetat med orkestreringsverktyg s√• som Ansible, Puppet eller SaltStack samt scriptspr√•k som Python eller Bash. Du beh√§rskar svenska flytande i tal och skrift.

Det √§r meriterande om du tidigare jobbat med transaktionsintensiva system med krav p√• h√∂g tillg√§nglighet och har erfarenhet av tekniker och tj√§nster som MongoDB, ScyllaDB, ELK, Grafana, Prometheus samt Jenkins.

Om Tech p√• Svenska Spel

P√• Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, √•ret runt och p√• sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den st√∂rsta penga√∂verf√∂ringsappen g√∂r p√• en m√•nad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av v√§rldens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi √§r med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tv√§rtom. Och som ett techbolag som sysslar med spel kommer ett ansvar, b√•de f√∂r folks dr√∂mmar och sp√§nning, men √§ven f√∂r deras spelande. Det √§r ocks√• d√§rf√∂r du kommer m√§rka att v√•rt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela f√∂retaget fr√•n f√∂rsta dagen du b√∂rjar jobba hos oss.

Vi √§r Svenska Spel

Vi √§r modiga, nyfikna och vi str√§var efter enkelhet i allt vi g√∂r. Vi vill att spel ska vara till gl√§dje f√∂r alla - f√∂r v√•ra medarbetare, kunder och g√§ster, f√∂r idrotten och f√∂r samh√§llet i stort. Vi sponsrar idrottsr√∂relsen p√• alla niv√•er, f√∂rebygger spelproblem och l√•ter vinsten g√• tillbaka till samh√§llet.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Arelion is a leading light in global connectivity and we've been keeping the world connected for nearly three decades. Today, the world's largest operators, content providers and enterprises rely on our #1 ranked global Internet backbone, AS1299, for their premium data and voice services.

Job description

We are Arelion. You may not have heard of us; though, we are pretty sure you are using our network every day. As a Tier 1 Network provider, operating the most connected Internet backbone on the planet, we are quite passionate about what we do. If you peek under the lid, you‚Äôll find all sorts of passionate geeks within; people who get out of bed each morning because they care for fiber cables, telco housing, routers, wavelength multiplex systems, and, even, software services. The one thing we have in common is our passion for the Internet and our honored customers.

We have taken a hybrid approach when it comes to IT infrastructure. Our applications and software services are running in AWS and our own datacenters located in two major cities in the EU. AWS is our firsthand choice. We apply some of the most modern technologies and concepts in our AWS environment, like IaC using Terraform and Helm to manage our EKS clusters. Automation is key for us, implementing CI/CD mainly using Github actions. Our monitoring solution is based on Datadog.

In order to let the Software Engineers focus on development projects, we are now looking to add two DevOps Engineers. Working with DevOps in the Software Engineering team will allow you to work closely with our Software Engineers and the Infra&Ops team to create and maintain the best possible environment for our applications. You will give us the best possible CI/CD pipeline, service availability, and proactive maintenance by mastering the components in our infrastructure domains. You need to have passion for IaC, Kubernetes, automation, monitoring, alerting, and continuous improvement. We‚Äôll offer the right candidate to chance to work with us in a multi-skilled, cross-border team supporting a multi-national organization with demanding customers. We offer an open environment where you‚Äôll be able to contribute, learn, and grow.

The main responsibilities are:

‚Ä¢ Automation of environments, tests, and deployments. 
‚Ä¢ Continuous improvements in environments and platforms such as Kubernetes 
‚Ä¢ Daily operations of environments and platforms 

The main tasks are:

‚Ä¢ Implement and maintain automation of environments, tests, and deployments. 
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Software Engineers to improve and maintain the operating environment for our applications 
‚Ä¢ Provide DevOps expertise in development and implementation projects 
‚Ä¢ Set up monitoring and logging 
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot issues in applications and environments 
‚Ä¢ Automate detection of anomalies and errors in a variety of components involved in our software solutions. 

Skills & Requirements

We believe that you have:

‚Ä¢ A degree in computer science or other relevant background 
‚Ä¢ At least 5 years of relevant work experience 
‚Ä¢ Required skills: 

‚Ä¢ 

‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Infrastructure-as-code with Terraform targeting AWS 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Github actions 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Docker 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Kubernetes 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Helm 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ AWS in general and most importantly IAM, EC2, ALB, EKS, RDS, Route53 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Bash scripting 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Automation tools like chef or puppet 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Linux server management 

‚Ä¢ Preferred skills: 

‚Ä¢ 

‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ IT security, such as certificates, cryptography, and authentication/authorization protocols 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Logging and monitoring products e.g. ELK or Datadog 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Application scaling and high availability 

‚Ä¢ Ability to plan your own work and work independently when needed but care about the team 
‚Ä¢ A passion to explore and learn more 
‚Ä¢ Good social and interpersonal skills 
‚Ä¢ We also expect you to be fluent in English, both written and oral 

Your personal characteristics

You have a strong will to contribute to the development projects and to the team output as a whole. You are eager to learn new things and at the same time open to sharing knowledge and experience with your colleagues. Furthermore, you are open to working in a mix of methodologies, nationalities, and cultures. You love technology and doing things hands-on. You aim at delivering high quality output but can at the same time accept that perfection is not always possible to reach.

Our current remote work policy offers the possibility for employees to work from home up to three days per week.

The position is located in Karlstad and is on 100%.

Please hand in your application by using the form below. The selection work takes place on an ongoing basis.

For further questions about the position please contact Sofia Graflund: 070-423 34 23, sofia.graflund@qtym.se

headline: DevOps Specialist
description.text:
The Techno Creatives is an inspiring place to work. We design amazing software and hardware solutions for a wide variety of problems. Anything you can think of - we can probably do it. And we probably did. And we got a design award for it. How do we pull it off year after year? It's easy. We care. We have compassion.

Now - caring is not pulling 60 hour weeks. Caring is not tweaking the database communication layer for the last 5% or achieving 100% test coverage. That‚Äôs obsessing. We don't do that.

Caring means understanding your users and customers and delivering what they need at a price they expect with a design that blows their mind.

Sounds like a tall order? That you'd have to be a genius? Actually no. You just need to be motivated by compassion. You need to care.

About you and the value you bring
At The Techno Creatives, no one person is one thing. We all have our Majors and Minors. You may be a Major in Android development, but your minors are Web and Unity. Or you're a Major Rust Firmware dev, but you can also do Python.

As a DevOps oriented person, this is second nature to you. You've dabbled in a number of languages across Linux, Mac, and sometimes Windows, as well as whatever runs up there in The Cloud‚Ñ¢. You're familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, and maybe even Terraform or Ansible, and you're not scared of shell scripts. Even if you're not that familiar, you're curious and willing to learn - a challenge is fun, after all.

About the job
The Techno Creatives is not the place of work where your job is to mess around with printer drivers and help people out with the WiFi password. We are plenty tech savvy. Your mission is to solve a problem in a way that it stays solved and that others can learn from. That means you‚Äôve been there - you‚Äôve seen things - and now you know what is likely to break.

You will work on new projects. Maybe deploying apps, helping out with CES demos, managing cloud services, tweaking CI/CD flows, setting up new infrastructure, strong-arming grub, updating Kubernetes, helping devs with ops, etc. Any number of things.



Why join The Techno Creatives
All in-house & Diverse of course
An international and interdisciplinary environment with teams working hands on with the development of future products for the world's leading companies. The perfect arena for you who love to learn and get better!

One floor
Studio located in the heart of Gothenburg with a 1500 sqm studio allowing you to be creative. Come visit our magnificent bar/kitchen, for hungry days with the teams and mingle events with our crowd.

Pick our battles
Want to explore a new business area? Learn a new technology? We search for projects within areas that interest us. What interests you?

T-shaped individuals
Curiosity is key, we encourage deep dives into expertise areas that we then share and teach each other through projects and learning sessions.

Agency & Product Company
Opportunity to gain experience in how to build products and companies across different industries. Short-term deliverables and long-term product development, and everything in between.

Soft & Hard
Our work cover hardware, cloud, and software and we have our own E-lab and Makerspace, for making your inventions come alive.

Health & Wealth
Health, wellness, and pension are of course covered by insurance and health care. Sauna and gym, to challenge yourself and dressing rooms with showers and towels to enable your morning run

About The Techno Creatives
The Techno Creatives is a creative tech house using technology in a creative way to solve real and worldly problems that have an impact on people's everyday lives.

We are merging strategy, design, and technology with a mission to be the go-to place for corporates and startups alike that are stuck in discussions, ‚Äòfailed already mode‚Äô, internal politics, or simply lacking the ‚Äòhow to‚Äô skills needed to progress towards their vision.

Our projects span all sectors and corporate types - but we always ensure to maximize the value-add for our clients, be involved early, and take responsibility for solving the real customer problem - not just our assignment. We take pride in finding creative ways to help our clients overcome whatever problems they have within the innovation or digital space.

Recent work includes creating digital experiences for Universeum to help develop the next generations, developing and bringing a Bluetooth-mesh-based lighting solution to market enhancing safety in high-risk industries, creating a connected child seat to prevent abandonment accidents, and a rental service for electric vessels, based on our own IoT platform, making the boating experience accessible by disrupting the ownership model.

With offices in Gothenburg and Shenzhen, covering hardware, cloud, and software we have the ability to take full ownership from initiation to continuous product growth.

headline: Devops engineer
description.text:
We are looking for a DevOps engineer to help us develop and scale our platform, teams and culture leading the way as a first class SaaS company in AdTech!
Why join us?ü§î
We live alongside our values of Passion, Collaboration and Challenge; with many events going on at Bannerflow such as padel tournaments, kick-ass inspiration webinars, Friday beers, health month and Level-up Hackathons, there‚Äôs something for everyone. As a member of the Bannerflow crew, you will get the opportunity to work with a creative, enabling, and highly advanced product within a 100% cloud-based architecture.
About the role üíº
We are looking for an engineer with previous experience in planning, designing and implementing DevOps processes, strategies and tooling to remove hurdles and pains from product development lifecycles.
As a DevOps engineer you will not only be building cool solutions but you'll also be working side by side with other teams, helping them with their daily challenges. Everything from educating, guiding and collecting feedback to preparing and driving workshops to scale our DevOps mindset and development efficiency. Here are seven insights into your responsibilities:
üîπPlan and implement proactive monitoring for our micro-services
üîπRefine and develop build and release pipelines using yaml
üîπCode and manage infrastructure as code  
üîπPlan and implement strategies for scaling our hosting and infrastructure  
üîπCollaborate with our feature teams to remove pains and optimize infrastructure, code releases and DevOps processes  
üîπIdentity and solve performance bottlenecks  
üîπScript and code internal tooling 
As a DevOps engineer you‚Äôll get the chance to have a great impact on where we‚Äôre going and how we are getting there.
About you üôã
In order to succeed in the role as a DevOps engineer we expect you to be a go-getter, have good communication skills, have a scalable mindset and be relentlessly curious. Having the ability to learn as you go while not being afraid of challenges and unknowns is the bread and butter of Bannerflow culture and we'd love to see that spark in you.
Since this team is new, we believe it is important that we as a team have an on-site first approach to work. In order to have direct and clear communications we believe it is important to work closely to the other teams. We would love to see that you have 1 or more years of experience in the following areas: 
‚úîÔ∏è Docker & Linux  
‚úîÔ∏è Azure & Azure DevOps  
‚úîÔ∏è YAML Pipelines  
‚úîÔ∏è Sufficient in either C#, Javascript/Typescript or some other relevant programming language 
Bonus points if you have relevant experience in DSL‚Äôs, Kubernetes, AKS, Angular and/or dotnet! ‚≠ê
About Bannerflow üè¢
Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. Each month our platform serves more than 6 billion ads, viewed on 500 million unique devices all over the world. This breaks down to a massive 20 000 requests and 1 GB of data transfer - per second, on average, constantly! To be able to deliver this, we have to stay in the front line of technical development and always keep up with the latest tools and technologies.
We advocate and work along with an agile architecture without hierarchy and bureaucracy where we work in small autonomous and cross-functional feature teams. We are a Creative Management platform that allows companies to focus on being creative rather than spending precious time on repetitive tasks and changing the game by removing the mystery of digital marketing. We simplify complexity, challenge the status quo and as a result we have the happiest customers in the world. 
Application ‚û°Ô∏è
The hiring process includes problem-solving, personality, and ability tests. However, our recruitment process is designed to be a two-way conversation. We want to get to know you and we also want to give you a first-hand insight into what it will be like to join Bannerflow. We‚Äôre super excited about receiving your application!
We do not accept applications over email, only through this ad. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact the recruiter Mathilda Wahl at mathilda.wahl@bannerflow.com
Screening and interviewing will be held continuously, so make sure not to miss out on this opportunity!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
It‚Äôs an exciting time to work at Hive Streaming! In these turbulent times, great employee video communication is crucial for enterprise companies to create engagement and alignment to survive and succeed. At Hive Streaming we are proud to offer an industry-leading solution to this demand. We help multiple Fortune 500 customers analyze, secure, and optimize their video experience on a daily basis.

Hive <3 Sustainable Growth

We have been a hypergrowth company for a long time - more than doubling our revenue every year. For the next phase of our journey, we want to continue that growth by financing it ourselves. By the end of 2022, we will be able to drive additional growth without the need for external capital. This is an exciting thing!

We want to grow sustainably when it comes to revenue when it comes to our people and our customers; they are what truly makes us succeed.

To help our customers to grow sustainably, we will help them by creating alignment and engagement of their employees. We will help them to reduce their carbon footprint through less travel and by increasing the lifespan of their existing infrastructure. All this is at the core of our product, the Hive Video Experience Platform.

The Perks of Working at Hive

üèº Have it your way! At the office, at home or on the ski slope (did we go too far?) - your way is the best way but flexibility is everyone's way at Hive! We use Microsoft Teams to collaborate, we have digital kick-off's and provide you opportunities to work either remotely or in a hybrid setting.

 Without you = no Hive? We are a fast-paced, global (over 35 nationalities among our 100 co-workers around the globe) scale-up company that empowers every single coworker. Everyone is unique and important for our growth. You will play an important role in the company‚Äôs future success.

üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Flexibility (cannot say it enough)... we have flexible working hours to encourage work-life balance.

 Contribution to innovation and a better world! Hive helps enterprises to communicate through video instead of flying people in from across the globe, which means Hive employees directly contribute to a greener world!

 The boring but most important... salaries are good, insurances are good, awesome health benefits (did someone say free massage at the office?) and hopefully you stay good (& healthy)!

Want to join our journey?

We are growing our Platform team and are now looking for our new DevOps Engineer to our Stockholm office. You will be part of our hybrid workplace, which means you have the opportunity to work remotely and occasionally at our office (to enjoy a free massage, team-building activities, and more).

What is Hive Platform team?‚ÄØ

The Platform team is the backbone of all engineering teams at Hive. Our team of backend, DevOps and cloud engineers takes care of a wide range of tasks that enable other teams to be successful and deliver value to our customers.

The Platform team handles the Azure cloud infrastructure, including things like the Kubernetes cluster that allow other teams to deploy their solutions to our backend. We also provide support to other teams with our backend development framework and supply the best practices and guidelines to serve as base of the development.

Our team is on-call 24/7, which means that we are always on top of any issues and incidents that might occur in the system. Our logging, monitoring and alerting systems allow to tap into the system health and ensure smooth operation for everyone at Hive, as well as our customers and partners.

What will you do?

We are dedicated to provide other engineering teams with a solid foundation for their work. Our scope includes but is not limited to:

- Setting up and maintaining infrastructure

- Monitoring and supporting the system with on-call 24/7

- Developing and maintaining the backend Scala framework

- Providing tools for other engineering teams

- Migrating data to better persistent storage

- Managing access rights and permissions

Who we are looking for!

In order for you to thrive in this role you are experienced with the following technologies and environments:

- Any cloud platform (Azure, Amazon, GCP etc.)
- k8s, helm, containers
- Terraform
- CI/CD and automation
- Willing to be part of on-call
- Networking knowledge (routing, IP-tables, DNS, certificates, etc.)
- Linux


The perfect match will be‚Ä¶

 A problem solver, and a good team player with a hunger for learning new things

 A networker, who's establishing credibility, trust, and influences and collaborates with other functions to deliver results through cross-functional processes

 A good communicator, seeking first to understand and then to be understood

 You are aligned with our Core Values; customer-centricity, innovation, and empowerment.

We hope you are excited about this opportunity and we look forward to your application!

headline: DevOps Developer
DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Are you tired of working in monotonous environments? Do you want to build a strong resume with advanced technologies and well-known companies? We are the answer! At SwedQ, the employee is always the priority, we listen to your preferences when it comes to your career path - Do you want to be certificated in AWS? We provide it. Do you want to build your own Team? Do it. Do you want to become a Solution Architect in the future? Let's achieve your goals together by designing a role that fits you, your wishes are our law.

SwedQ is a consulting company that works towards becoming the first choice within development and digitalization through delivering tangible results based on our clients conditions and business objectives. We accomplish this by focusing on the Know-how, experience and right competence.

What's in it for you?

As a DevOps engineer with SwedQ you will get exposed to bleeding edge technologies, varying environments and challenges each day. We are hiring before having an assignment, we design the role together based on your preferences and experience. Our assignments and solutions are provided throughout all types of industries, but our main focus is within the IT sector. For now, our consultants are working on everything from implementing a new architecture of a cloud solution, to helping to set up the new back end system for autonomous vehicles.

Our clients

The limit is infinite. We work with smaller fintech companies to the more known companies in Sweden. Currently our consultants is working with: Spotify, H&M, Scania, Ericsson, Schibsted among many others.

You will bring:

- Minimum 3 years of experience working with DevOps.

- Strong analytical / problem solving skills
- Good communicator
- Fluent English
- Experience in designing and working with cloud infrastructure.
- Experience from building data pipelines in a cloud environment.
- Good knowledge of at least one programming language.
- Good knowledge in AWS, Azure or GCP.
- Experience with modern way of working: Microservices, serverless frameworks, Containerisation (Docker and Orchestration with kubernetes)


SwedQ culture

Our culture is very, very important to us, we value low hierarchy, independence and responsibility, value-creating work and having fun together. We believe in diversity and equal opportunity. At SwedQ we want you to be yourself and we value the differences in people, come to the office in flip flops or high heels, as long as you feel comfortable.

We believe in having fun and making memories, to maintain that we do a lot of activities such as playing football tournaments, going on trips and organising dinners.

Perks & Benefits

- Competitive salary

- Flexible working hours
- Budget to spend on health and gym
- Generous developers budget
- Fully paid relocation package - Work permit, flying tickets & the service to find apartment.
- Monthly payments into you additional pension fund
- Health insurance
- Office in the City - Stone's throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
- Support for open source projects and community engagements

- Developers time, to use during work hours for your personal growth
- Kick-ass colleagues and mentors at every corner


Other information about the employment

- Start - Immediately / as soon as possible

- Employment - Full time
- Location - Stockholm


Since SwedQ is one of the natural fastest growing consultancy companies in Sweden, we will always be looking to recruit more people. Make sure to get in contact with us to learn more about us and our clients. We always looking forward to establish a future relationship.

Trygg-Hansa har gjort skillnad i m√§nniskors liv sedan 1828 och √§r i dag en del av Tryg-koncernen, Skandinaviens st√∂rsta sakf√∂rs√§kringsbolag. headline: OSS DevOps Engineer
description.text:
About this opportunity
Dedicated Network is a segment of Business Area Enterprise Wireless Solutions (BEWS) which ventures well beyond the traditional boundaries of Ericsson‚Äôs core business. Demonstrating growth within global connectivity management, connected vehicles, industrial site connectivity, data, and network insights and security automation, we build customer and enterprise value. We are bold, making calculated bets on the future and working with us means you will be a pioneer ‚Äì shaping the future for us, and Ericsson. The team has a key role in putting connectivity in a box, creating dedicated networks for our customers, enabling connectivity in mines, airports, ports and more. Our product called Ericsson Private 5G (EP5G) is taking the world by storm. We have a huge focus on UX, putting that on the fore front of everything that we do.
 
What you will do
You will be responsible for our cloud-based micro service OSS system called Ericsson Network Manager (ENM) that is deployed on several clouds around the world serving enterprise customers. Your team will be involved in developing new features to satisfy the needs of our Enterprise customers. You will also be working with our talented development teams on the system integration between ENM and our EP5G product and troubleshoot issues whenever they arise.
Some tasks of the team include (not limited to) Integration, tool- and automation development, process and method development, test and verification.
 
You will bring
Experience with Google Cloud (Strong cloud understanding)
Good knowledge of Kubernetes, Jenkins
Solid and extensive Linux experience
Strong network understanding
Scripting and automation experience
Strong debugging, troubleshooting experience

 
Also good to have
OSS Domain Expertise and system tuning and performance
Rosetta or Terraform experience
Creating/updating their own MOPs
Experience from large customer integration projects
Preferred at least 3 years developer experience
Experience from test and verification

 
We highly value your curiosity and willingness to learn!
 
Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you¬¥ll have an outstanding opportunity! The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what¬¥s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world‚Äôs toughest problems. You¬¥ll be challenged, but you won‚Äôt be alone. You¬¥ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
 
What happens once you apply?
Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
 
Application:
We look forward to receiving your application in English. Please note we cannot accept applications via email.
 
Primary location for this role: Goteborg, Sweden
 
For specific questions please contact Recruiter: Monika Jasinska monika.jasinska@ericsson.com
 
We welcome the opportunity to meet you!
 
 
Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.
Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

headline: Business Analyst DevOps
description.text:
We are looking for a Business Analyst for our client in the area of aftermarket.
In the role as a Business Analyst, you will be involved in development and maintenance of diagnostic service based systems and tools supporting the aftermarket needs. Your responsibility is to identify and define the solutions that will maximize the value delivered to stakeholders. All work is done in agile teams in iterative collaboration with other specialists. 
Duties: 
As a BA you are need to understand the business and system requirements and gather input from stakeholders that need to be involved in the project. You are responsible for the planning, organizing, reporting and following up the requirement activities in accordance with the development processes. You need to ensure that the requirements are correctly understood by the team. You provide support for prioritization of scope and communication channels for end users. You facilitate the collaboration within the agile team, when it comes to requirement breakdown, solution architect work, coding and testing.
 Skills/Experience required:
 ‚Ä¢      A Master or Bachelor degree in Engineering, preferably Electrical Engineering, Physics Engineering or Mechatronics/Automation Engineering, or Computer Science. 
 ‚Ä¢      Good knowledge about electronics and embedded SW development
 ‚Ä¢      Basic knowledge of the Vector tools; CANoe and CANalyzer
 ‚Ä¢      Good knowledge in Python and DevOps
 ‚Ä¢      Good knowledge in agile SW development way of working including CI/CD 
‚Ä¢      Good understanding of: HTML5, CSS3, javascript, GraphQL, Restful services,  Containers, Azure Cloud
‚Ä¢      SAFe and ISTQB certificate is a plus
‚Ä¢      Excellent English both spoken and written
‚Ä¢      Used to working in a multi-cultural environment 
Additional info:
We schedule interviews on a rolling basis so do not wait until end date.

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Build your future with Sovos.
If you are looking for an opportunity where career-minded professionals can achieve success while bringing their best and whole selves to work each day, Sovos may be the company you have been looking for. Employees at Sovos operate on the leading edge of digital technology while working to improve lives and the communities in which we live and work. When we say Solve Tax for Good, we mean For Good in every sense of the word. Our organizational commitment is to provide a place where employees can thrive and progress in their careers while having the support behind them that only a global company can offer.
Sound like this might be the opportunity you have been looking for?
Take a look at our career posting below. Don‚Äôt check all the boxes? Apply anyway! We are focused on hiring the right people, not the ‚Äúright‚Äù CV.
It‚Äôs not about what you have done somewhere else, it‚Äôs all about what you are capable of doing here.
The Work You‚Äôll Do:
Using the latest technologies such as Azure DevOps, Terraform, Kubernetes, the Senior Dev Ops Engineer works closely with Agile Development teams and SaaS Operations department to understand, analyze, and design quality technical solutions that support our Agile Software Development Life Cycle model. The Senior Dev Ops Engineer will design and implement multiple applications build, release, deployment, and configuration activities.
More specifically, you will:
As part of a Sovos Platform Team, responsible for design & implementation of cloud environments to engineering teams, also responsible for driving DevOps, SecOps (shifting security left in lifecycle), SRE practices.
Build & Implement the baseline, building blocks for different cloud services, security, automated pipelines, monitoring, logging, and observability of cloud platform.
Design and implement the lifecycle of common Cloud, DevOps and Security tools used in software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Coaching engineering teams with best practices and ways of working in Cloud, adopting DevOps & Security practices, running Kubernetes clusters, data & analytics, machine learning workloads in the cloud.
Collaborate with software engineers and product owners in achieving the best cloud development experience for engineering teams.

What We Need From You:
Proven Experience in working with AWS services and delivering Cloud solutions at scale
Proven Experience in Infrastructure as Code using for example Terraform, Puppet or Cloud Formation
Experience in using one or more scripting languages
Strong experience with CI/CD technologies, for example Azure DevOps, TeamCity or Octopus Deploy
Knowledge in networking and related services such as DNS, Load balancing, CDN etc.
Working experience of message queue technologies is highly valuable (RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc)
Fluent in English

What Does Sovos Offer You?
The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work
Continuing opportunities for further Learning & Development
Progressive Wellness Program
A chance to work with talented and passionate people in a rewarding and values-driven environment!
Visit our careers page to learn more!

Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work
Company Background
Sovos was built to solve the complexities of the digital transformation of tax, with complete, connected offerings for tax determination, continuous transaction controls, tax reporting and more. Sovos customers include half the Fortune 500, as well as businesses of every size operating in more than 70 countries. The company‚Äôs SaaS products and proprietary Sovos S1 Platform integrate with a wide variety of business applications and government compliance processes. Sovos has employees throughout the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We are now looking for profiles with 5+ years who have good hands on working experience in Automotive domain in CI/CD pipelines. We have a close collaboration with a number of market-leading local companies. Here you get the opportunity to be a part of one.

We would like you to have:


‚Ä¢ Programing Languages: C++, C, Matlab, Python
‚Ä¢ CI/CD:¬† Jenkins, JFrog Artifactory, Docker,Kubernetes
‚Ä¢ Software Configuration Management Tools: GIT, Gerrit, Gitlab/Github, JIRA
‚Ä¢ Automotive Process Standards: ASPICE, ISO26262 System Safety
‚Ä¢ Methods: AI, Machine learning,¬† Agile
‚Ä¢ Cloud Competence: AWS or Azure

Nexer as an employer¬†
At Nexer, we think that every new idea, every innovation and new acquaintance is a promise of a better future. For you, for our customers and for the world we live in.

The future is not a distant dream, it is created by the actions we do today. At Nexer, you get the opportunity to dream big, think smart and make sure things really happen. We take visionary ideas and create concrete strategies. We use technology as a tool for progress and find new ways to communicate.

We work value-driven and put our heart into everything we do. You get close to those who make decisions and you can always be involved and influence. If you work at Nexer, you get a strong employer with an international presence and great opportunities to develop.

Application
Welcome to submit your application below. We accept applications on an ongoing basis. If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact the responsible recruiter Sugandh Agarwal at sugandh.agarwal@nexergroup.com

More about Nexer¬†

We lead the change and constantly strive to find new technical solutions. If there is a smarter way to do something, we will find it. We challenge ourselves every day to think outside the box and help our customers to always be one step ahead. Services in digitization, IT and R&D provide increased customer value and growth for organizations in both the Swedish and global markets. We have also been named Microsoft Country Partner of the Year in Sweden and Brazil - twice.

Our great community involvement in Star for Life, My Life, Pink Programming and the Code Center also gives you as an employee the opportunity to make a real difference.

Nexer is entrepreneurial and has over 1500 experts in strategy, technology and communication. We are located in nine countries and in more than 20 locations in Sweden. Nexer is part of the Danir Group and was previously called Sigma IT.

headline: Senior DevOps engineer
description.text:
Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That‚Äôs why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.
With international calling, money transfers, mobile top-up service and more we design products with the needs of modern migrants in mind.
Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day‚Äîand we‚Äôre looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.
Rebtel is looking for a Senior¬†DevOps Engineer
About Rebtel‚Äôs infrastructure
Our infrastructure is entirely cloud-based and we have components in the 3 major cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP). Our infrastructure hosts our customer-facing business applications as well as support systems used internally by different teams. Given how long we have been around, we have some legacy applications and systems that run on VMs in the cloud, but our preference is for containerization orchestrated by Kubernetes.
In an environment as vast as Rebtel‚Äôs, it is important to maintain thorough documentation of our systems, but even better to persist our infrastructure as code using modern tools such as Terraform. Our work approach is well structured without being stifling. We use an agile workflow to handle day to day tasks. We strongly encourage collaboration as an excellent way to spread knowledge and to deliver universally relevant products and services.
Given our fast-paced journey and market ambition, you will find tasks that are demanding and that will trigger your creativity. At Rebtel, everyone contributes to our customer propositions - we have quick communication channels between teams and have¬†regular hackathons to respond to opportunities and challenges as they come.
Rebtel is looking for a DevOps and Infrastructure engineer to join its team that is building new products and services in a modern, cloud-based ecosystem.
About you and your responsibilities

We‚Äôre looking for an individual who we can learn from and help us take our infrastructure to the next level.
We love to share the knowledge we have and to learn new things from you.
You have keen interest in architecture: how to build complex systems that are maintainable.
As an Infrastructure and devops engineer, your role will include actively contributing towards architectural decisions. You will discuss technical solutions with the rest of the team and act as an inspiration to improve and maintain system stability, availability, and security.
You are interested in problem solving and enjoy finding the simplest possible solution to complex problems.
You work well with teams, even in areas besides DevOps and infrastructure, but are also capable of performing as a sole contributor in your area

Requirements

Experience with Azure and, preferably, also with GCP and AWS.
Good understanding of security in the Devops area.
Experience setting up CI/CD pipelines using common tools deployment tools (GIT, Azure Devops, Teamcity, Octopus)
Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform and Ansible
Sound knowledge of networking principles and common concepts such as firewalls, load balancers and application gateways and debugging tools such as Wireshark.
Good understanding of containerization using Docker, Kubernetes and Helm charts
Experience with system administration on both Windows and *nix based platforms including scripting using Powershell and Shell.
Excellent communication skills in English

Bonus points

Knowledge of IP telephony and related technologies/protocols such as SIP, WebRTC.
Experience writing and automating system tests as well as incorporating them into CI/CD pipelines
Experience working with cross functional teams on mature products with many users
Experience working with standards for compliance in the payments industry e.g PCI

Ideal candidate

3+ years full-time professional experience (i.e., 6k+ hours)
Committed to documenting and automating routine tasks
Raise the level of everyone around you
Happy hacking on new technology, loves R&D
Always curious, always learning
Vision for product development and for how a code base evolves
A pleasure to work with

¬†
We are Rebtel - People from all around the world, as of now 23, countries and more to come. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

headline: Salesforce DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Ready to join our Digital Transformation?


We are looking for a Salesforce DevOps Engineer with at least 2 years experience of handling Salesforce releases, joining our Salesforce Chapter Europe team of specialists, supporting a wide variety of product teams to deploy and operate the releases in our Salesforce pipelines.
You are a self-motivated professional who likes to take responsibility, come up with ideas of improvements, and collaborating closely with stakeholders, developers, and architects during our Salesforce release phases.
You also have a customer-first mindset and is ready to challenge the status quo and an ability to solve complex problems and think out of the box.


Your typical tasks include
Deploy custom Salesforce applications using the Copado platform utilizing several Salesforce products, such as Sales Cloud, Experience Cloud, Commerce Cloud and help to achieve the business goals by releasing with quality and on time.
Lead the work, aligning different product teams to perform synchronized releases into a common Salesforce production org.
Work in a team centric environment where a culture of innovation allows your input and ideas to become part of the solution.
Develop plan for delivering on commitments, and then execute on those plans following agile methodologies.
Sharing of information and learnings, all while working in a fast-paced environment



About you - must have
In depth knowledge of the Salesforce platform and what variants of metadata might be deployed.
Experience and ability of using different release strategies and pipeline setups, and knowledge of choosing the best solution for a particular situation.
Experience using GIT and resolving merge conflicts.
Familiar with using Apex (classes and triggers), Visualforce, Lightning pages, Aura Components and Lightning Web Components.
Deep knowledge of Salesforce development best practices and frameworks
Attained at least 2 relevant Salesforce certifications as a minimum
Ability to collaborate effectively with team members in different geographies.
Excellent written (Business & Technical), verbal and listening communication skills.
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.



Good to have
Proficiency of using Copado as a release management tool
Copado certifications
Experience with test automation
Experience developing using Salesforce B2B Commerce for Visualforce or B2B Commerce on Lightning
Education
A Bachelor of Science or Master of Science degree in Computer Science, Engineering science, Information Technology, or other equivalent/related programs.



What‚Äôs in it for you?
Possibility to upskill, attend trainings and take certifications
Volvo benefits, for example a yearly company bonus
Collaborate with like minded people, enthusiastic about the Salesforce platform
A high performing team and a positive atmosphere where mistakes are welcome as part of the learning
Exciting business solutions you‚Äôll help to release, collaborating with Volvo CE, Volvo Trucks as well as other divisions of the Volvo Group
A challenging environment where 2 days never look the same
Salary to be negotiated depending on experience and skill sets



Contact us!
Herou, Henrik +46 700838805


Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
