headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Why Lifesum is your next career move

Hi, this is us!

Lifesum is the world‚Äôs leading nutrition platform. We help over 55M users around the world improve their lives through healthier eating. Headquartered in Stockholm, we‚Äôre a global team of passionate entrepreneurial individuals, working together to build something that truly matters.

We want you to share our excitement about the future
Today the global wellness market is valued at $1.5 trillion, and a third of consumers are expected to increase their usage of nutrition apps, diet programs, and subscription food services this year.

Our technology team works to ensure that this is all possible. We want you to bring your expertise as you will have a great impact on how the platform team works and how we build things - for example building scalable microservices, new infrastructure, making architectural decisions, database designs, and working with test-driven development. We know you can learn things from us, as well as we want you teach us things we don‚Äôt know.

You should be able to work independently as a subject matter expert. Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer, the Senior DevOps Engineer is a key position that acts as the bridge between the technology and product to the global markets we serve. As such the new Senior DevOps Engineer will have a pivotal impact on the development building of the leading global platform for Healthy Eating, Simplified.



Your experience will be a valuable asset


- You want to be part of developing and evolving the best nutrition platform in the world

- You always strive to do better and learn new things

- You have extensive hands-on experience and knowledge of development, both from an architectural perspective and hands-on development

- You have many (8+) years DevOps & Developer experience

- You have experience in creating and maintaining complex cloud infrastructure

- You have past experience building scalable microservices, AWS, Kubernetes, Testable code, Event-Driven Development (Queues/Messages/Streams), Python, database design, and software architecture

- Knowledgeable in multiple programming languages including go

- Experience writing and designing microservices

- Experience working with systems with millions of users

- Experience working with different NoSQL databases

We offer

- Trust and responsibility in a fast-paced environment

- Opportunity to work on a range of exciting projects with many of the most successful companies in the world

- Space and support to develop and grow your own career

- 30 paid vacation days per year

- Parental pay

- Pension

- Private health and medical insurance

- Individual training and development budget

- Referral bonus

- Wellness allowance

- Flexible work

- Great team activities

We are just getting started
At Lifesum we also not only embrace diversity, but we rely on it to succeed. That‚Äôs why we work hard to ensure our team, vendors, and partners are representative of the millions of users we serve.

If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you and get to know you. Send us your resume right away; tell us why you are interested and why Lifesum feels like your next career move. Everyone is welcome; we look forward to your application!

headline: AWS DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Company Description
Devoteam A Cloud Sweden is the most recent addition to the Swedish Devoteam family. We specialize in bringing together and growing AWS expertise - we‚Äôre a team of curious, bold and brilliant people. At A Cloud, we combine startup flexibility and creativity with the operational and capital support of an enterprise. At Devoteam we collaborate with our customers in finding the next innovative solution that will support the customer to achieve better business results.
We always base our advice and implementations on proven best practices. Working as our customers‚Äô trusted architects, we secure the platform for the future and provide solutions to support their business demands. We work agile with prototyping to show early effects and opportunities.
We specialize in Edge Computing including IoT, Serverless, Data Streaming and Analytics, Modernization & Migration as well as Security. 
Job Description
We are seeking a skilled DevOps engineer to join our delivery team. In this role you will work closely with software engineers and other team members to design, implement and maintain infrastructure and automation solutions on the AWS platform. You will be responsible for building and managing AWS environments, CI/CD pipelines, automating infrastructure deployments and ensuring the observability, reliability and scalability of the solutions. 
Key responsibilities:
Design and implement infrastructure automation solutions on AWS
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines
Collaborate with software developers to automate application deployment and infrastructure management
Monitor and optimize system performance and capacity using observability tools
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in production environments
Continuously improve processes and practices to increase efficiency and reliability

This is a hands-on role and will require a great deal of ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude!
We have a hybrid office working model and like to occasionally meet the clients‚Äô team at their offices.
Qualifications
We believe that you are open-minded to new ideas and flexible when meeting new challenges to succeed in this role. You have the ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively to deliver on time and with quality. You enjoy collaborating and are comfortable sharing your knowledge with your colleagues and clients.
Key requirements:
You have been working at least 3 years on the AWS platform.
Proficiency with AWS, including strong experience with Terraform.
Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as Python or Go.
Strong understanding of CI/CD concepts and best practices, with experience using tools such as Jenkins, Github Actions and CircleCI.
Good understanding of observability and used tools such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana or Datadog.
BS in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience.

You are fluent in English on a professional level in order to communicate with various stakeholders, both technical- and business-oriented. 
 
Additional Information
At Devoteam Stockholm you get:
Challenging and rewarding assignments; many of them end-to-end
Wellness grants for sports activities (5000 SEK/year)
Passionate and skilled colleagues 
Human-centric and value-based culture
Variety of social events

About Devoteam A Cloud 
Devoteam A Cloud is a Premier Partner to AWS with 4 competencies, 400+ AWS certified experts and 700+ certifications. In 2020, Devoteam A Cloud trained over 1000+ people.
At Devoteam, we deliver innovative technology consulting for businesses. As a pure player for Digital Transformation of large organizations across EMEA, our 10000+ professionals are dedicated to ensuring our clients win their digital battles. With a unique transformation DNA, we connect business and technology. Present in over 20 countries in Europe and the Middle East, and drawing on more than 20 years of experience, we shape Technology for People, so it creates value for our clients, for our partners and for our employees. Our mission is to build cultures of innovation at companies by transforming the way they work and by elevating their customer experiences.
We are looking for people with big ambitions, who want to grow with us and help companies build a culture of innovation with AWS solutions.
At Devoteam, we share our knowledge, learn from each other and from other experts by giving or listening to talks, participating in Hackathons, taking hands-on classes and getting certified. 


A fair chance.
Devoteam is open to applications from all sections of society. We believe diverse teams help us make better products. We welcome all people regardless of age, gender, experience and background. 
If you can see yourself in this role and feel you can bring value and a unique perspective to Devoteam, we encourage you to send us your application - even if you do not necessarily meet all the above requirements.
We apply continuous recruitment, so make sure to send in your application as soon as possible, given that Devoteam A Cloud‚Äôs recruitment process allows us to hire someone else before the last application day.

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
About us
doWhile is a company that strives to give its employees the creative freedom to explore new ideas and innovations that make an impact on the world. We achieve this by building products with high quality and high value for our customers, and by constantly learning through collaboration with our customers.


doWhile develops high-end CI/CD solution products and also offers software development at customer sites (CI/CD, automotive, telecom, game development etc). We are searching for great developers.


doWhile was founded in 2017 by a group of talented and driven software professionals and engineers and we are 40+ employees today. We believe that with talented individuals, who have the support and backing from the whole group, we can achieve great things together.
Your role
As a senior DevOps engineer at doWhile you will work with our clients to build high-quality infrastructure and solutions using modern technologies and methods.
Responsibilities
Build mission-critical high-quality infrastructure. 
Build infrastructure and integration components that follow industry-standard design patterns, development methodologies, and deployment methods. 
Take part in system architecture discussions. 
Provide technical leadership. 
Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders throughout the development process. 
Help clients transform into using DevOps best practices and methodology to increase quality and speed up deliveries.





Basic Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, math, scientific or technical discipline. 
Passionate and fluent in Linux, computer networks, container technology, and cloud infrastructure 
2+ years of experience in software development.  
4+ years of experience in DevOps 
Interest and ability to learn new technologies as needed.

Preferred Qualifications  
Deep understanding of cloud computing; virtualization, hosted services, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems, and content delivery networks. 
Deep understanding of testing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment. 
Experience with networking technologies, load balancers, firewalls, API proxies, and web security mechanisms, and virtual network functions. 
Experience with deployment and orchestration technologies such as Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, etc. 
Experience with Continuous Integration orchestration technologies like Jenkins, Bamboo, Gitlab CI, SonarQube, artifact management tools, License and security scanning tools, etc. 
Professional experience with multiple programming languages such as Java, C#, C++, Python, GO, and Lua. 
Experience with database systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Cassandra 
Experience in system administration tasks in Linux, Unix, or Windows 
Experience with IT security practices such as encryption, certificates, public key infrastructure, etc. 
Ability to work independently and in a team. 
Interest and ability to learn new technologies and programming languages as needed. 

What we offer
An environment with great colleagues who support each other. We have an open atmosphere that is great for learning and everyone is encouraged to ask for help and get input. You will work with skilled and talented engineers who want to make an impact. We often meet outside of work and do fun things together such as game nights, parties and outdoor activities.
Other perks and benefits
International working environment
Visa sponsorship and relocation package
Gym and fitness perks
Private health insurance
Work/life balance
Career development support
Parental leave and extra compensation
Competitive salary
Paid time off and flexible schedules

Equal Opportunity Employer


doWhile is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment at doWhile is based on merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability.

description.text:

Det √§r √§ven meriterande med erfarenhet inom:

Vi har en hybrid arbetsplats som inneb√§r en kombination av att arbeta p√• kontoret och p√• distans vilket betyder att man b√∂r kunna vara p√• kontoret flera dagar i veckan. I v√•r v√§rld rekryterar vi personligheter. K√§nner du att det h√§r √§r n√•got f√∂r dig vill vi g√§rna veta vem du √§r. headline: DevOps Engineer to RLDatix
description.text:
Want to be a part of making healthcare safer and join a global company with people who are passionate about what they do? RLDatix are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join their team. Sounds interesting? Please continue reading!

What will you do?

We want to welcome you to a company that loves learning and developing. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be involved in the cloud journey and the handle of our Swedish Data. The field in which we operate moves fast and we move with it with curiosity and passion regarding how we can make people lives better.

You will be a part of our DevOps team and work closely with our developers whilst being our Cloud Native DevOps. You will join a learning culture and a team that enjoys sharing best practice and being innovative. We celebrate new ideas and individuality.

Who are you?

You would probably describe yourself as the operational one who is very interested in the technical side. The need and willingness to continually learn is in your core and working in a team with all that entails is a given for you.

We also believe you recognize yourself in the following:

- You are a cloud native and feel very comfortable in cloud services like AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform
- You have experience in scripted languages, preferably PowerShell, Bash or Python
- You speak both Swedish and English


Perhaps you also know some other parts of our tech stack:

- Jenkins
- Octopus
- Microsoft SQL
- PostgreSQL
- Mongo DB
- Kubernetes
- Docker


About us

We are a global team that is passionate about improving healthcare. We believe in what we do and truly want to make a difference in the lives of patients around the world.

We believe in a world where patients have access to quality care, where workforces are supported by transparency and empathy and where organizations are committed to an overall culture of safety.

Contact

In this recruitment, we are collaborating with Wise IT. If you want to know more, contact the responsible recruitment consultant Alexander Lindgren at alexander.lindgren@wiseit.se. Unfortunately, we cannot accept applications via email as we protect your privacy. You can read more about how we process personal data according to the GDPR in the Wise Group Group‚Äôs policy for the processing of personal data

Selection is ongoing, we welcome your application!

headline: Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer
description.text:
At Paradox, we are focused on bringing value to our community by creating groundbreaking features for both players and game developers. If you are a passionate Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer who would like to work at a successful games company, full of people passionate about technology and games, read on and learn how you can be part of the fun and talented Central Tech and Services (CTS) department!
Your adventure starts in the Infrastructure team to work on various development projects focused on delivering new and updated features for internal development teams, Paradox game studios, and our players. This also means that you will be working with projects related to the Paradox game development studios, as well as the publishing organization. You will also manage platform stability, features, and costs while assisting the development teams to guarantee we continue delivering Paradox‚Äôs signature experiences.
As an engineer within the Infrastructure team you will work with Paradox‚Äôs different platform environments, services and related infrastructure. Your day to day activities will include monitoring and maintaining our platform and cloud resources related to online services, as well as internal scripts and utilities shared within the department. This will also include maintaining the automated build and deployment pipeline (CI/CD). You will also support other teams with knowledge sharing as well as mentoring team members.
The skills we‚Äôre searching for‚Ä¶
5+ years of professional experience, preferably in a services/DevOps team
3+ years professional experience in cloud operational infrastructure and services
Professional experience working within one or more public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
Professional experience of Terraform and Kubernetes
Comfortable with a range of programming languages and technologies
Coding/scripting knowledge for automation of infrastructure
Experience with code versioning tools, such as Git or similar frameworks
Experience for mentoring other members of the team

You as a candidate:
We believe you are a service-minded, driven, and explorative individual. You have an eye for details and are comfortable with solving problems and working autonomously within a group. Your role in a team is flexible and can include being the one who identifies viable solutions and implements appropriate solutions, as well as mentor others. Your English communication skills, both written and verbal, are excellent and are backed by patience in taking the time to understand others as well as in explaining yourself.


Practical information:
Scope: Full time and permanent
Reports to: Cloud Operations Manager
Location: This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden

headline: DevOps Engineer - Observability
description.text:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, TV channels and production studios. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.

We may have started in the Nordics, but we have a global mindset and consider ourselves to be the international streaming challenger. This means we‚Äôre constantly launching our Viaplay streaming service in new markets and on the lookout for talented, curious, driven professionals to join us on our journey.

Right now, we‚Äôre searching for a DevOps Engineer within Observability to our Stockholm office - are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?

The role

You will be part of the Engineering team in the Technical Operations Center (TOC). Our mission is to build solutions and tooling that help Viaplay Group and the 24/7 Technical Operations Center strategically and in the daily work to reduce incident resolution time as well as proactively prevent them across our platform and services. Today eight skilled engineers and great team players with individual crafting specialties are running the show and we need you to strengthen us within Observability Engineering.

The TOC Engineering team has a broad area of responsibilities, and we currently have a set up with smaller focus groups, Tooling & Automation, Observability and Security. We are right now in need of someone that can drive and mainly work end-to-end with development and engineering within Observability.

You will have a key role in setting up infrastructure which enables our stakeholders to have insights in our platform‚Äôs capacity, health and performance. As part of our mission, you will support in promoting adoption of observability tooling. You will:

- Design and build an observability infrastructure across teams.

- Educate and lead efforts to improve observability across teams.

- Design and implement monitoring and alerting strategies to enforce application SLOs.

- Build tools and design processes that help improve observability and system resiliency.

- Set up dashboards, alerts, detectors that reflect the system's capacity to provide high quality and secure customer experience.

What we‚Äôre looking for

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that‚Äôs why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you‚Äôll have at least some experience in the following:

- Working with observability tooling, such as OpenTelemetry, Vector, Prometheus, Jaeger, Grafana, ELK and/or Splunk.

- Development skills in languages such as Python.

- Infrastructure as code, such as Terraform and Troposphere/CloudFormation.

- Cloud infrastructure at scale with AWS using container orchestration, functions, roles, databases, queues and data streams (or other equivalent cloud experience).

- Experience with Linux internals, containers and shell scripting.

- Drawing architectural diagrams, guides and documentation to share across teams.

- Designing and implementing solutions end-to-end across teams.

- Solid experience with source code and binary repositories using git.

- Automated continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines using GitHub Actions or similar.

And you are a problem solver at heart who thrives in a collaborative environment. We also believe that you are a communicative individual.

It‚Äôs a bonus if you have:

- Development skills in languages such as Go and JavaScript

Our offering
- We‚Äôve got the basics covered (and then some)! 30 days of paid vacation every year, flexible work arrangements and extra compensation on top of a parental pay lift.

- Your wellbeing matters. We have an attractive pension and insurance scheme with full healthcare coverage should you need it.

- A safe space to grow and up-skill with the freedom to try new things in autonomous teams. Our learning culture puts you in the driver‚Äôs seat of your own development, while always making sure you feel supported with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical training, mentorship opportunities and peer-to-peer networks.

- An innovative environment with Hack Days, not once, but twice a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.

- A genuinely international and diverse group of colleagues to connect with. We‚Äôre striving towards a 50:50 gender balance & we‚Äôre not far off -‚ÄØplus last time we checked, we have more than 60 different nationalities across our nine offices!

- Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product -‚ÄØincluding live sports & pay per view events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.

Hit play today
If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here -‚ÄØyou may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don‚Äôt send us your application via email because we won‚Äôt be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page (https://careers.viaplaygroup.com/) or follow us on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/lifeatviaplaygroup/)! We‚Äôre only ever a few clicks away.

headline: Global Azure DevOps Specialist
description.text:
Epiroc is a leading productivity partner for the mining, infrastructure and natural resources industries. With
cutting-edge technology, Epiroc develops and produces innovative drill rigs, rock excavation and construction
equipment, and provides world-class service and consumables. The company was founded in Stockholm,
Sweden, and has passionate people supporting and collaborating with customers in more than 150 countries.
Learn more at www.epirocgroup.com.

Global Azure DevOps Specialist
Epiroc is currently seeking a driven Global Azure DevOps Specialist with a can-do attitude to be part of Epiroc IT.
As a Global Azure DevOps Specialist, you will:
  *  Be a part of Epiroc‚Äôs digital journey and enable hundreds of developers to be more productive.¬†
  *  Establish a global application governance of Azure DevOps and document Azure DevOps best practices.
  *  Facilitate regular meetings with key stakeholders and drive community of practice to capture, analyze, and implement new Azure DevOps requirements and ways of working.
Help the teams to secure the deliveries with:
- Static code analysis
- License scanning of third-party tools
- Secret scanning on code base
- GDPR scanning on code and work item data

  *  Continuously learn technical skills and knowledge, keep up to date with the market.¬†
  *  Be part of evaluating Epiroc future development platform like Microsoft Dev Box and other alternatives.
  *  Be our representative towards Microsoft in matters related to Azure DevOps.¬†


Your profile
As a person you are organized, independent and your work is influenced by structure. We believe you are customer-oriented, and service minded.
You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field combined with Azure certifications. A solid experience working with Azure DevOps is required. As a Global Azure DevOps Specialist, you need to be able to design and implement strategies for collaboration, code, infrastructure as code, security, compliance, continuous integration, testing, delivery, monitoring, and feedback.¬† Additionally, you have good understanding of Agile and Lean concepts and methodologies and good understanding on how to design, build, test, and maintain cloud applications and services in general.
As our corporate language is English, verbal, and written communication skills in English are required.

Life at Epiroc
By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We work in a global environment with over 113 different nationalities!¬†
In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, there are some things that makes us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc:¬†¬†
  *  Global career opportunities
  *  Epiroc University, for your own competence development
  *  Community involvement
  *  Benefits package, which amongst other things include flexible working hours and bonus.

A hybrid workplace¬†
Life at Epiroc can include the possibility for a hybrid workplace. It is a way of working that offers flexibility and participation allowing for a better balance between work and private life, which also promotes well-being. The hybrid workplace is an opportunity if work allows, based on your role, responsibilities, and individual conditions.

Application and contact information
In this recruitment process, we review applications continuously. Welcome with your application as soon as possible by creating an account in our recruitment system. Last day to apply for this position is 2023-02-12.¬†
For questions about the position please contact hiring manager: Andreas B√ºlow, Enterprise Architecture & IT PMO Manager, andreas.bulow@epiroc.com
For questions about the recruitment process or application please contact: Recruitment specialists Jenny Flygare, jenny.flygare@se.experis.com or Luka Jovovic, luka.jovovic@se.experis.com.

headline: DevOps engineer to Elekta!
description.text:
Do you want to be a part of a Cloud journey? We are now looking for Elekta's new Linux System Administrator to their DevOps team in Stockholm. Elekta‚Äôs history and success has been built on people who turn today‚Äôs challenges into tomorrow‚Äôs solutions. The purpose of all the work they do at Elekta is to help clinicians improve patients‚Äô lives. If you‚Äôre as passionate about humanity and innovation as Elekta are ‚Äì apply below!

OM TJ√ÑNSTEN 
As a leading innovator of precision radiation therapy solutions, Elekta is committed to ensuring that every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta's offering allows clinicians to treat more patients with increased quality, both with value-creating innovations in solutions and AI-supported service based on a global network.

We are looking for a Linux system administrator to join Elekta's DevOps team. The DevOps team is a service-oriented group of three that provides the engineering team of approximately 70 people with IT infrastructure, tools, and tool support for software development and continuous integration.

As a Linux System Administrator, you'll have the opportunity to:


* Be part of an inspiring company that's embarking on an exciting cloud journey.
* Work alongside other talented and senior professionals to shape the direction and success of this initiative
* Be part of a team that's making a real impact


With these opportunities, you'll be able to take your career to the next level!

This is a consulting assignment where you will be employed by Academic Work and work at Elekta with the possibility of being recruited by our client, provided a satisfying collaboration. As a consultant for Academic Work, we offer great opportunities for you to grow professionally, build your network, and create valuable contacts for the future. Read more here!

ARBETSUPPGIFTER 
As a member of the DevOps team, you will work on a wide range of tasks with a focus on Linux administration, infrastructure automation for provisioning of virtual machines and containers both on-premises and in the cloud, networking and security, and proactive monitoring and maintenance of infrastructure on-premises and in Azure. Today, the team uses tools such as Jenkins, GIT, Subversion, Artifactory, and Prometheus.

Elekta follows an agile methodology (SAFe), and you will be part of a scrum team. You will interact frequently with your team members as well as other development teams and the IT organization.

VI S√ñKER DIG SOM 
To be a suitable candidate for this position, we think you are an experienced Linux System Administrator or Software Engineer with DevOps experience. We believe you have a relevant university degree, such as in computer science, or extensive experience. In terms of language, you possess a proficient level of English that is suitable for business purposes. This is because English is the primary language used for communication at Elekta.

We think you have earlier experience in one or more of the following areas:


* Linux system administration
* Automation of server provisioning and maintenance (i.e. SaltStack or Ansible)
* Virtualization and container technology (KVM, Docker, etc.)
* Good working knowledge in scripting languages such as Python, bash
* Network configuration


Knowledge or experience in the following areas is a merit:


* Standard tools and technology for DevOps (i.e. SCM, CI/CD Pipelines)
* Cloud solutions (i.e. Azure)
* Agile ways of working (Scrum, Kanban and/or SAFe)


We will focus on the following behaviors during the recruitment process:


* Problem solver
* Self-sufficient
* Communicative


Other information


* Start date: As soon as possible
* Extent: Full time
* Location: Central Stockholm, Sweden


The recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and Elekta's wish is that all questions regarding the position are handled by Academic Work.

We go through the selection process on an ongoing basis, and the advertisement can be closed before the position is filled if we have moved on to the selection and interview phases.

headline: DevOps Engineer - 378721
description.text:
Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, trams, and e-buses to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide.
 
Are you looking for a new challenge and want to bring new green solutions to the world market? If you are driven by product development and believes that your team members are your most important assets, then we would like to get to know you! 
 
Join us as a DevOps Engineer based in Gothenburg, Sweden 
 
 
Your mission?
 
 As DevOps Engineer you will support the project delivery team. You will have the accountability for creation, maintenance, and evolution of software development/test infrastructure.
 
Your key responsibilities?
Development and maintenance of Linux based infrastructure.
Implementation of CI/CD pipelines
Maintenance and development of current solutions
Internal processes automation
Supervision over development environments
Help with code failures analysis.
Close cooperation with test and development team
Solving problems on test and dev environments
Creation and maintenance of tech documentation

 
Minimum qualifications:
Engineering degree and/or master‚Äôs degree preferable of Science in Engineering
Understanding of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) processes
Knowledge of Linux operating systems and administration
Comfort to administer Linux OS (CentOS, Ubuntu)
Experience with configuration management tool (Ansible)
Proficiency in at least one of the following scripting languages: Python, Bash, Groovy
Expertise in Docker, knowledge of how to build, operate and deploy Docker containers.
Experience with CI/CD tools configuration (Jenkins, Git)
Knowledgeable in network, firewall and security best practices
Broad knowledge of IT infrastructure automation in general
Advanced written and spoken English.

 
Ideally:
Experience in C code development
Familiar with Docker Swarm
RPM packages creation
Knowledge about Solaris
Experience with monitoring tools (Grafana)
Familiar with WSL

 
 
 
Why Alstom? 
Alstom is the leading company in the railway sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow‚Äôs mobility. That‚Äôs why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive, and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose? 
 
Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

headline: DevOps Engineer to Prorenata!
description.text:
Prorenata is looking for a driven (dev)OPS Engineer

We at Prorenata are building an operational system for student health. That's the boring version. What we're really trying to do is provide useful, simple, fun tools for our users who otherwise often are stuck with hard-to-use, outdated systems. We enjoy helping people, and this shows in our support where customer satisfaction is very high.

We are a growing company, today we are about 35 people, but we have the privilege of having a large influx of customers and we want to take care of those customers. Now we're looking for a (dev)OPS Engineer , and that's where you come into the picture.

Are you curious about why we write (dev)OPS? Let us tell you:

In this role, there will be more focus on operations than development. Which is why we are looking for you who is in love with the operations part of (dev)OPS. You will be a part of our DevOps team together with other colleagues.

Your job will consist of monitoring, managing terraform, managing alarms, and being an important part when it comes to the structural security of our systems. In addition to this, you must enjoy dealing with the unexpected tasks that arise during the day and leaning towards the operational side of the job which will contribute to helping us keep the system in good condition.

Who are you?
We believe that you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, especially with cloud solutions. We are looking for people who are curious, organized and have a genuine interest in operations and databases. This role requires you to be fluent in English and it is a plus if you know Swedish as well.

These are some of the technologies, frameworks and services that we use:

- Kubernetes/Docker
- OpenStack or Cloud
- Operations of IT systems (availability, logging, monitoring, security)
- GitHub
- Helm
- Python scripting
- Database administration (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
- Terraform
- CI/CD pipelines


What we offer:

We offer an exciting work environment in a lovely office at Skeppsbron in Gamla Stan. Our workplace is characterised by a friendly atmosphere with colleagues who take care of each other. Our current hybrid model offers the possibility to work both in the office and remotely, since our teams work in an agile way, they are jointly responsible for the presence in the office.

Apply today!

Interviews are ongoing, so submit your application today. If you have any questions, contact me on sandra.wikstrom@prorenata.se

Tillsammans med kollegor kommer du vara med och s√§tta upp samt underh√•lla IT-infrastrukturen f√∂r UR:s digitala tj√§nster, arbeta med installation och underh√•ll av operativsystem och mjukvara f√∂r b√•de in-house utvecklade- och externt utvecklade system.¬†Tillsammans med ditt team kommer du att:¬†
* S√§tta upp och underh√•lla olika delar i v√•r IT-infrastruktur som front proxies, HTTP Cache, webbservrar, Java-baserade stand-alone applikationer, meddelandek√∂er och g√§stoperativsystem (Linux) i VMware.¬†
* Avlasta systemutvecklarna genom att fungera som avancerad first line support och st√∂dja den √∂vriga verksamheten med fels√∂kning och liknande.¬†
* Skapa och underh√•lla Amazon Machine Images (AMI:s) p√• Amazon EC2.¬†
* Bygga upp system f√∂r IT-automation och konfiguration mha. t.ex. Ansible.¬†
* Vara med och bygga upp system f√∂r automatisk √∂vervakning av delsystem till UR:s plattformar inom programproduktion, broadcasting, podcast, streaming och metadata.¬†


Vem √§r du?¬†¬†Vi s√∂ker dig som √§r noggrann, nyfiken och ser l√∂sningar ist√§llet f√∂r problem. Du b√∂r uppskatta samarbete likv√§l som du kan agera sj√§lv och ta initiativ. En √∂ppenhet f√∂r att ta till sig och vilja l√§ra sig nytt samtidigt som du kan komma med egna f√∂rslag och id√©er √§r en f√∂ruts√§ttning f√∂r att v√§xa i rollen. F√∂r att lyckas bra i rollen beh√∂ver du en bred erfarenhet av intern infrastruktur och en eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant omr√•de. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes¬†√§r det meriterande. ¬†

headline: DevOps Engineer for Software Tools
description.text:
DevOps Engineer for Software Tools

The complexity of developing Electronic Control Units becomes manageable with the help of our software tools. We develop new and sophisticated functions for our design and configuration solutions. If you are enthusiastic about software development and DevOps, and you like to coordinate with colleagues in order to achieve the best overall solution, then this position is just right for you.

What you‚Äôll do

You will be part of an agile team, implementing a reliable, high-performance and adaptable CI/CT/CD infrastructure for our Software Tools. Your tasks will include:

- Analysis of complex CI/CT/CD pipeline requirements and development of extensions for the continuous optimization of our CI/CD pipelines.

- Rollout of infrastructure changes, as well as support in the application of the infrastructure by the product development teams.

- Creation of tailor-made solutions in close coordination with the product development teams.

- Work towards meeting performance requirements.

You will be working with very competent co-workers in the Software Tools department located in Link√∂ping and Germany.

About you

You have the ability to work & collaborate in a team environment and are not afraid of taking on new responsibilities within the team. A degree in computer science or equivalent experience is needed with knowledge of build and DevOps technologies such as Gradle Enterprise, Git, CheckMk, Jenkins, Docker and Kubernetes. As a person you are ambitious, self-driven and have good communication skills.

Following skills/experience is an advantage

- Experience in deploying, operating and monitoring distributed applications for the cloud, such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS and the associated services.
- Practical experience in the field of infrastructure management and system architecture.

About Vector

We are a global, continuously growing engineering company. For over a quarter of a century, we have been at the forefront of electronic innovations within the automotive industry and related sectors. Vector has over 3,000 employees at 29 locations worldwide, supporting manufacturers and suppliers with a professional platform of software and hardware tools, embedded software components, and services for developing embedded systems. All with one mission: Simplifying the development of automotive electronics and software!

In Sweden we have a quickly growing Product Development Center of more than 60 engineers in Gothenburg and Link√∂ping working close to our large development centers in Germany. To support the local customers, we have teams of around 25 product experts providing product deliveries and product support to customers in Scandinavia.

Why Vector Sweden?

We provide an attractive, high-tech working environment and our employees are at the heart of our success, using their creativity, passion, talent and skills. When we hear ‚ÄúThis is impossible!‚Äù we put our heads together to make it possible. Our projects aren‚Äôt just about work. They are challenges that our employees strive to meet working together as a team. Every day we are working on emerging technologies of the future and our employees are the source of our innovative drive.

In G√∂teborg and Link√∂ping you will have the atmosphere of a small company with the resources of a global organization. We have a work climate characterized by helpfulness and trust. You will always feel supported by your manager, team members and others within the company! At Vector Sweden we embrace diversity and are proud to have co-workers that are passionate about their work from all over the world! This makes us a productive workplace where we have fun together!

headline: DevOps Engineer to E-invoicing Platform
description.text:
The adoption of electronic invoicing is spreading at a rapid pace. Our customer provides world-leading SaaS based solutions for e-invoicing that contains features for digital signing, tax reporting and cloud-based archiving. The solutions smoothly integrate with commonly used ERP platforms and are used to enforce compliance with regulations in an international environment. These solutions are currently used by more than 7,000 corporations around the world.


We are now looking for a DevOps Engineer that will join their international development organization. They are currently in the interesting phase of building a completely new platform that will replace the different solutions that they have today. You will work in an agile and well-structured environment developing a modern and scalable software platform.


In this role as DevOps Engineer, you are focusing on automation of the software build, development and delivery process. You are focused on implementing good processes and tools for Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.


We believe that you have the following qualifications:
- 3+ years of relevant working experience
- Solid experience in DevOps related tasks
- Experience in Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment
- Experience in TeamCity
- Good knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes
- Previous background in software development or TechOps is an advantage
- University level studies in computer science or similar
- Good English skills verbally and in writing


If you find our proposal interesting and you meet the above requirements for the position, please don't hesitate to apply.


All applications are treated strictly confidential. Applications will be handled as they are received.


About Jobshark:
Jobshark is offering recruiting services for the IT sector. We have about 200 customers and among them some of Sweden's most prominent technology companies. Jobshark is headquartered in Sweden and is part of a company group with about 50 employees.

headline: Cloud Engineer / DevOps developer
description.text:
We are seeking an ambitious and highly skilled Cloud engineer that will help maintaining and evolving our AWS deployed infrastructure.
About the company
DynamicSource develops advanced systems for airlines and the aviation industry.
Our software is found in the cockpit and operations offices of many major airlines worldwide.
Our knowledgeable staff consists of airline pilots, performance engineers, software developers and business developers. We are now looking for a new star in our team to help us fly higher.
Your Job 
 * Maintain, deploy and care for our infrastructure
 * Identify, evaluate and implement new technologies and solutions
 * Continuous performance tuning, optimization and improvements
Skills
 * Managing Infrastructure (IaC) with Terraform
 * Linux Administration
* Security focus, general IT security knowledge
 * Highly self-organised and disciplined / experience with remote work
Good to have!
Experience with...
 * AWS services EC2,RDS,ALB
 * Kubernetes
 * Ansible
 * node.js, Python, PHP, Bash, OOP
 * CDCI -- Jenkins
 * Interest in aviation (bonus point)
Working conditions 
The DynamicSource team is in the greater Stockholm area. Work from our central Stockholm office (5 min walk from Central Station) and/or remotely.
Next Steps 
Please email your cover letter (including your salary range expectations) and your CV in Swedish or English, with the subject: 'Cloud Engineer / DevOps developer' to recruitment@dynamicsource.se.
We will review applications continuously.

headline: DevOps Engineer, Infrastructure Services (Full-time)
description.text:
At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital‚ÄØtransformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we‚Äôre developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus‚Äô Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?‚ÄØ‚ÄØ



https://se.linkedin.com/in/stefan-sk%C3%B6ld-31206b15), our Head of Infrastructure Services, is looking to strengthen the team with a talented DevOps Engineer to join our Stockholm office. Stefan is looking for someone who shares his pride in a stable, robust, and manageable IT infrastructure. You, who have been around and know the fundamentals of IT Ops and want to help us become even better in delivering XaaS solutions, scalable production environments and reliable core infrastructure.

What we offer you

- You will join a skilled and dedicated team, working closely with both products and customers. The solutions you build have a profound impact on millions of users each day.

- Stay relevant regarding security topics by joining an innovative identity and security company that secures society by enabling "Zero Trust" identities for people and things, in both the physical and digital world.

- Have the opportunity to collaborate and make a difference every day; we are small enough so every individual counts, and big enough for you to have work security and development opportunities.



What you‚Äôll do at Nexus

As a DevOps Engineer, System Admin, IT Ops, or SRE (you can name it with many titles), you will take part in the day-to-day, running and maintaining the infrastructure that hosts production- and end-user platforms supporting critical applications.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

- Design, build, and maintain the core infrastructure used by all Nexus as a service offerings

- Troubleshoot issues across services and levels of the stack.

- Fine-tune monitoring (We use Datadog/OpsGenie).

- Plan for the growth of Nexus infrastructure.

- Ensure that the platforms always run at an up-to-date level.

- Work with customer tickets and act as 3rd line support to our technical support team.

On top of the day-to-day IT Ops work, there will always be other fun stuff to do, and depending on your own desires this could differ. This might include pen-testing, migration/transformation projects for customers, IT management tasks like incidents or changes, TSP management with CA ceremonies, deep-diving into automation etc.

Some of our Tech Stack: Terraform / Terragrunt, Kubernetes / Docker / Containers, Ansible, Azure / Azure DevOps, CentOS / RedHat / Rocky / Linux Datacenter operations, ITIL, Change management, Networking (Cisco) Firewalls (Clavister / Cisco) VMware, HSM (Hardware Security Modules) and more!



About you

- As a person you are a meticulous problem solver, focusing on details to enable robust and stable solutions. You like to work in a team but have no problem driving your own stories and projects.

- You‚Äôre persistent and if you see a problem you will point it out on every single stand-up until it‚Äôs taken care of.

- You are adaptable and not afraid of change.

- You work well with other people and relate to them in a responsive and smooth way. You understand the importance of listening, communicating, and resolving issues together in a constructive way.

- You enjoy being innovative, creative and active in your working set-up.



Qualifications

- You have a background and interest in IT Ops and Infrastructures. You think about systems, their edge cases, failure modes and lifecycles.

- You know your way around a CLI.

- You can troubleshoot complex problems across the whole stack.

- You know how to translate the business needs into workable tech/infrastructure by writing IaC.

- You understand the importance of holding yourself and others to a higher bar.

- Because this is a 24/7/365 environment we generally want everyone to take part in the on-call rotation every 6-8 weeks. If this is a big issue for you, let us know and we can discuss it.

-
You have a working proficiency level in English.



Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?

At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We‚Äôre dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we‚Äôre looking for, please consider applying.

About your CV and the Process

You will not be asked to do a two-day assignment as a skill assessment, we do real-time tech interviews together with the team and we do not require you to apply with a resume/CV. Who has an updated resume anyway?

Transparency, security and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before employment.

Nexus is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives and your background to thrive, collaborate and be forward-thinking! It‚Äôs in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.

headline: DevOps Engineer for Inify Laboratoriesüë®‚Äçüî¨
description.text:
Inify Laboratories provides cancer diagnostics through ultramodern laboratory services within pathology. It uses a fully digital, standardized and AI-supported workflow to optimize quality and response times, initially within prostate.
We are now looking for a DevOps Engineer to join their team!
Job Summary

As a DevOps Engineer, you will optimize tools and methods in the process from machine learning research, through design, implementation, integration, test, deployment, and operations of information systems. At one end of the process, you will be working with management and processing of training data for machine learning. At the other end you will be selecting operations platforms, ensuring effective operations, and establishing mechanisms for operations monitoring and user feedback.

As most of the team is located in Link√∂ping, this will be the preferred location for new team members, but Stockholm is also possible for those prepared to travel to Link√∂ping on a regular basis. Aside from some in-person meetings in the Link√∂ping office, they offer a choice between working in the office or remotely.

This is a 6-month consulting assignment where you will be employed through us at Wrknest and work at Inify Laboratories. You have a good chance of being employed by Inify Laboratories after the consulting assignment. If it suits you better with a direct recruitment to Inify Laboratories that option is available, with a probationary employment of 6 months.

Job Description
- Continually, together with the process owners, optimize the DevOps process.
- Build and acquire tools for automating, accelerating, and monitoring the DevOps process.
- Support all roles in the DevOps process with expertise, methods, and tools.
- Define operations models for information systems (on-premises, cloud).
- Evaluate and propose suppliers for information systems operations.



Key Qualifications
- You speak and write English fluently, skills in Swedish are a plus
- Knowledge of all steps in the DevOps process (machine learning, development, integration, verification, deployment, operations, server administration, backup, monitoring, and user feedback)
- Understanding of on-premises and cloud operations models and their tradeoffs
- Knowledge of cybersecurity
- Good programming skills in Python
- Understanding of GPU clusters for machine learning would be beneficial



Tech stack
The currently used technologies are:

- GitLab (Git, CI/CD, Issues, ...)

- Python

- Ubuntu/Linux

- Docker

- Ansible

- IPv4 Networking

- Proxmox.

Understanding of HTML and JavaScript would be beneficial.

What Inify Laboratories offers
- The chance to make a real difference in cancer care.
- Interesting problems that nobody has solved before.
- Great learning opportunities.
- Opportunities to publish research.
- Brilliant and friendly colleagues.
- An enlightened and rational culture.
- Flexible working arrangements.


Additional information

Start: Immediately with regard to any notice period
Place: Link√∂ping/Stockholm
Form of employment: Full-time 40h/week

Please apply as soon as possible as we work with ongoing selection.

 For these positions, you need to live in Sweden and have a Swedish work permit.

https://www.inify.com/)

Inify Laboratories (https://www.inify.com/)

Inify Laboratories is building its first histopathology laboratory in Stockholm, Sweden. Our pathologists and personnel will be supported by state-of-the-art information systems, such as a proprietary AI-based pathology decision support tool, the Inify pathology workstation with structured reporting, and a tailor-made laboratory process support system. The R&D team of Inify Laboratories will continually improve the digital tools using an agile devops process. Together with the medical and laboratory staff, as well as external partners, they will also participate in research activities to further the state of the art of digital pathology.

headline: Junior DevOps Engineer to Telia
description.text:
Are you a team player with a big interest in IT, who wants the opportunity to further develop your career at one of Sweden's largest IT companies? Do you want to be part of Telia's team that gives you a varied and developing workplace where you get to work with Telia's strategic IT applications to support the company's business? Are you ready to take the next step in your IT career? Apply today!  

OM TJ√ÑNSTEN 
On behalf of Telia, Academic Work is looking for their next Dev-Ops Engineer in Service Order Management and Activation.

This is a consulting assignment. You will be employed by Academic Work and work as a consultant at Telia. The assignment will be full-time. There are good opportunities to be over-recruited, given that all parties are satisfied with the cooperation.

ARBETSUPPGIFTER 
In this position, you will be part of the SOM and Activation team working in an Agile way, following the Agile Release Train processes. You will be working within a wide range of diverse technologies stretching form databases, networking, servers, clusters and other components and services. The team is also in the middle of the Cloud Native transformation, introducing products running in K8s.

Typical daily tasks will involve participation in system design, environment setup, proactive and continuous service improvements, but it can also include incident management, life cycle management, installations/patching and problem resolution.

Further job duties include:


* Troubleshooting and resolving issues in development, test and production environments
* Application deployments and configuration changes to support new releases
* Analyzing system/processes and initiating necessary improvements and changes
* Incident & Problem management with a proactive/preventative approach, ticket handling
* Taking on the technical role as the DevOps engineer in ARTs and also being able to run smaller tasks
* Developing tools to support our systems
* Automation improvements
* GRC (Governance, risk, and compliance) controls execution
* Knowledge base maintenance
* Collaborating with other teams and solving complex issues


VI S√ñKER DIG SOM 
- A candidate with a BSc or MSc towards the IT area or a Vocational Degree towards Dev-Ops specifically (minimum 2 years)
- A candidate with fluency in English in both speaking and writing
- Great skills in Linux

Merituous:


* A candidate with previous experience in a Dev-Ops position


As a person, you have good communication skills & enjoy collaboration with others. You are self-organized and structured. You are also adaptive, persistent, and willing to take initiatives.

In order to be eligible for the role, you will undergo a security check by Telia. To pass the security clearance, you must also have been a resident in Sweden during the last 3 years.

Other information:


* Start: As soon as possible
* Work extent: Consultant assignment fulltime, long term
* Location: Solna, Stockholm


This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client‚Äôs wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.

Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase.

INFORMATION OM F√ñRETAGET 
Telia Company AB is a Swedish multinational telecommunications company and mobile network operator present in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia.

headline: Continuous Delivery and DevOps Consultant
description.text:
Continuous Delivery and DevOps Consultant
Consulting - Stockholm
Would you like to join the Nordic leaders within Continuous Delivery and DevOps?


We are looking for a person with a growth mindset and a passion for development, who wants to be a part of our team of expert consultants. 
We act as a strategic partner to our clients where we assess their needs and deploy consultants that can make a strategic impact. Our success lies is having a strong-knitted and diverse team, characterized by technical excellence, quality of work and an environment where we share our skills and expertise.


As a Continuous Delivery and DevOps Consultant you will be making sure organizations become more efficient in their software development and delivery process. You will be leading with example and keeping up-to-date while writing code. Moreover, you will design and improve software development using Continuous Delivery, Lean, Agile and DevOps ways of working.


To succeed in this position, you need: 
Minimum of 3 years of industry experience within software development or operations
Knowledge of a contemporary programming language (such as Java, C#, Python or Go)
knowledge of a scripting language (such as Bash, Groovy, Python, or Ruby)
knowledge of infrastructure automation tools (such as Terraform, Ansible or SaltStack)
knowledge of a major build tool (such as Maven, NPM, Gradle or Make)
Experience with monitoring tools, logging infrastructure and tracing frameworks
Experience with container technologies (such as Docker, Kubernetes or Mesos)
A solid understanding of Lean and Agile software development methodologies
Professional working proficiency in English



It would also be a plus if you have experience: 
Working as a consultant
Coaching and leading people
Implementing Continuous Delivery and/or DevOps
With any of the major cloud providers (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform)
With Extreme Programming (XP)
With Linux system administration 



In both 2017 and 2018, Diabol was recognized as a ‚ÄúGasell Company‚Äù by Dagens Industri, due to our fast growth and strong financials over the previous four years. This is your opportunity to join one of Stockholm's most exciting consultancies!

headline: DevOps Engineer for building CI/CD pipelines
description.text:
Our offer

As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you are part of something bigger. In multidisciplinary teams you make your contribution to the most innovative products in the rapidly transforming automotive industry. 

All our projects, whether in-house or at our leading customers, are part of our ambition of making life more advanced, more sustainable and easier. Capgemini Engineering offers you a work environment branded by ambition and care. You will be working with cutting edge technology, developing yourself surrounded by dedicated colleagues with high expertise.

Your role
The skills and proficiencies required to fill up this role are: 

 - Proficient in at least one of the scripting languages like Python, Shell, Groovy etc.
 - Expertise in using DevOps tools like Git and GitHub, Jenkins for building CI/CD pipelines
 - Good to have strong testing skills 
 - Experience of working with tools like artifactory (JFrog), Dockor and Message Bus
 - Proficient in cloud platform tools like Amazon web services or Azure
 - Software development methodologies
 - Software architecture.

Proactively drive initiatives to improve project delivery e.g., improve code quality, suggest changes to ways-of-working and more. Proven success in a team orientated environment and use of agile methods. 

It is important that you want to work with the latest technologies and have a drive to make a difference with a strong delivery mindset. 
Your profile
Bachelor, Masters, or Civil Engineering degree
5 years of DevOps engineering experience.
Fluency in both Swedish and English.
Good communication and interpersonal skills. 

Application and contact
Selection and interviews are running continuously.
Apply now since we assign roles during the whole application time span.
For questions and for more information contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, 0725-616900 

We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements. 

Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided every day by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of ‚Ç¨16 billion.

Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

headline: Senior Software Developer in DevOps (716895)
description.text:
Do you as a developer want to work in the middle of everything? Then apply for a position in CAT team!
 
We are looking for an agile developer with a genuine interest in technology, programming, and scripting to strengthen the Continuous Automation Team (CAT)
CAT is responsible for the continuous integration and automation incl tools within BOS organization. The services are utilized by several organizations across multiple sites.
As a successful candidate you will work within this agile team, interacting with several of our software development teams within the BOS portfolio, to realize improvements and maintain the Continuous Automation environment, incl tools.
 
The main responsibility for the CAT-team is to provide and maintain automated test and development environments, both in software development pipelines and virtualized environments. The CI/CD environments are used by the BOS products in the daily work from development to customer delivery.
This is done by e.g improving the user environment, providing the necessary tools for the developer, shortening our Continuous Integration lead time via automated jobs to ensure fast feedback loops in general and being the interface towards the IT and test environment organization.
 
What you will do
Work with continues improvements and drive towards modern technologies
Develop tools and services
Perform trouble shooting and customer support
Be a part of an impactful team that can make a change in the organization

 
You will bring
A university degree (MSc or BSc) in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar
At least 5 years of experience in product development
Excellent skills in communication, both verbal and written
Very good skills in software development
Deep skills in programming in general. Meriting Python, JavaScript, Groovy
Deep experience of Linux systems
Experience in general tools and techniques: e.g. Docker, GIT, Jenkins, Maven, Mesos, MongoDB, MySQL, Gerrit, Kubernetes
A team spirit

 
Meritorious qualifications:
Troubleshooting skills ‚Äì which in its turn require to have hands on experience of signaling and platform (HW, Hypervisor, OS, 3PPs and APIs)
Good understanding of infrastructure, networking and IP in general
Experience of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA, web services, REST)
Experience of agile development

 
Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you¬¥ll have an outstanding opportunity! The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what¬¥s possible. headline: Humble DevOps Engineer with Python skills
description.text:
About the opportunity:

We are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer that has worked with Linux based embedded systems. You will get the opportunity to join an innovative company within the telecommunications service provider market with a highly-skilled R&D organization.

Your profile should include the following:

- Experience (5 years) within SW development/test in embedded systems
- You love Python development
- Experience in CI/CD using Jenkins (Groovy and pure Bash)
- Yocto or Buildroot for building an embedded Linux distro
- Daily usage of Git
- Fluent in English

About Insert Talent

At Insert Talent, we put your interest and career first. We have a transparent set-up where you are first permanently employed by Insert Talent as a consultant, usually 6-12 months. After that period you will have the option to join our client company as a permanent employee.

Please note that it is an option, meaning it's up to you and the client to find an agreement after the initial consultancy period. We are always transparent regarding salary expectations and benefits, which simplifies reaching an agreement with the client company.

If you decide not to join the client company for some reason, it is our responsibility to find you a new assignment that is a better match. Our success rate at finding a great match is very high, and it is our goal that you become permanently employed by our client company.

The model is appreciated both by our candidates and our clients.

Follow our open-source work at www.gorillabanana.com (https://www.gorillabanana.com/) (https://www.gorillabanana.com/)
