headline: Senior DevOps Engineer - Toca Days
description.text:
Toca Days is our most ambitious project yet - a friendly multiplayer world for children celebrating the excitement and quirkiness of everyday life. A 3D world where kids can play and explore in real time through their own avatar.

We‚Äôre in the process of consolidating our cloud tech into one cloud provider. To do this we need an experienced DevOps Engineer with focus on AWS, infrastructure, and automation, with deep knowledge of cloud platforms, service and solid engineering practices to allow us to fully utilize the platform. 

You‚Äôd be working in Toca Days while closely collaborating with Central Tech that is responsible for the tech stack as a platform. You‚Äôd be in a position to set best practices, and have ideas and opinions about how we improve both efficiency and quality. 

What you‚Äôll be doing

In this role you‚Äôre involved in the full product cycle for services, infrastructures and automation in the Toca Days project, from green field development to maintaining the scalability and performance with millions of users.

You‚Äôll lead the creation of processes that serve developers with a fast, consistent and easy way to integrate and deploy services and game builds and with that let game team developers focus on building the best possible game. 

You will be creating processes and tools and introducing best practices for things like AWS usage, monitoring, cloud strategy and handling security for backend services. Together with the rest of the team, you‚Äôll define and set up common levels of monitoring of backend services.

You‚Äôll be the one leading the work with our existing cloud infrastructure, and will support and coach the other developers in the usage of AWS and tools within infrastructure, ensuring sustainable development processes and workflows.
Is this you?

You have solid professional experience with AWS at scale, preferably for non-web consumers (apps, other services, apis etc). Along with that, you have experience building and deploying services in the cloud, and living in an Infrastructure as Code environment. 

You have knowledge about containerization (i.e. Docker), Kubernetes and IaC (Terraform and/or CloudFormation), and a good understanding of databases preferably both relational and nosql databases. 

With excellent communication skills, you‚Äôre able to merge non-technical requirements into a technical solution

If you have knowledge about the Unity build pipeline and assets packaging pipelines, that‚Äôs a plus.

This is us!

Toca Boca captures the spirit of play. We create digital toys and everyday products that are filled with fun and silliness that kids from any corner of the world can instantly relate to. Everything is designed from their perspective. We celebrate the diversity and quirkiness of their world and give them the freedom to play in ways that only they can.

Good to know!

This position is full time and based in our Stockholm studio with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You‚Äôll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support with relocation. As we‚Äôre an international company, with over 20 nationalities working here, and millions of users all over the world, you need to be fluent in English. Your application should therefore be in English. 

Come join us - it'll be fun!

Toca Boca develops digital games that capture the power of play and that are filled with fun and silliness that kids around the world can instantly relate to. Since our first product launch in 2011, we have released 46 apps that have been downloaded more than 444 million times the world over, making us the No. 1 mobile-first kids brand in the App Store. Our products focus on sparking kids‚Äô creativity and imagination, creating opportunities for open-ended play.

With offices in Stockholm and San Francisco, Toca Boca is owned by Spin Master Corp., a global children‚Äôs entertainment company that creates, designs and manufactures a diversified portfolio of innovative toys, games, products and entertainment properties.

headline: Senior Cloud Operations Engineer - DevOps
description.text:
Are you an experienced Cloud Operations and DevOps professional? Do you have experience managing the life cycle of resilient and secure micro service architectures in public cloud environments? Are you a large-scale change agent and advocate of DevOps principles? Join our team in Stockholm as Cloud Operations - Senior Engineer and enjoy a dynamic environment where you can make a difference!  
 
At ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions we are working with Identity and Security Solutions. We reimagine how people move through their world, whether that world is a cruise ship, education facility, hotel or care facility. In the division we have collected brands and business areas as diverse as Hospitality, Marine to Construction and Senior Care but they all have some common traits:
Selling solutions, not locks or access control systems
Direct sales model (B2B)
Software centric products

 
Many of the business areas are in the beginning of their cloud journey and need help in both enabling cloud native product development and establishing platforms to offload the product teams‚Äô cognitive load and give a great developer experience and a reliable product operations.
 
Our small team Cloud Operations is responsible for a couple of Platforms: IAM, SSO, CI/CD incl. SCR, Testing, Compute (AWS looking to onboard Azure), Security and Monitoring and we are looking for more team members to mature and develop them as well as act in an advisory capacity to help the Product teams to develop.
 
What would you do as our Senior Cloud Operations Engineer
We organize ourselves in small cross-functional teams, where you will be working closely with the developers, ensuring automation in application level (unit tests, data tests, and integration tests). You will be the driving force for maintaining and improving the AWS infrastructure, as well as have an advisory role towards the business areas in explaining architecture patterns and system solutions among others.
The tasks can involve anything from configuring load balancers setup AWS security, backup automation, maintaining and developing CI/CD systems that is hosted on AWS and GitLab.
 
You would also:


Help business areas and product teams to onboard their workload to cloud and business agile/DevXOps transformation
You will apply your expertise to build and run scalable and fault tolerant soluton
Automate cloud solution implementation using latest DevXOps CI/CD tools and pipelines
Implement and manage cloud-native solutions

 
In this role you will report directly to the Director Cloud and Product IT Operations at ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions and will be based in √Örstadal, Stockholm.
 
The skills and experience you need
We believe you are an experienced cloud engineer familiar with DevOps practices, who loves being part of a team delivering high quality platform and you do this by sharing our belief in the agile values, being motivated, focused, taking initiatives, and being eager to learn.
 
We are looking for someone who:


Has experience with CI/CD, Security, Automation, Scripting, Cloud, Log management, IAM, NW, Kubernetes
Has a background as a Software Engineer with DevOps focus or a System Engineer that have developed Infra-as-Code capabilities with 5+ years of experience - strongly preferred
Speaks fluent Swedish 
Is proactive, works efficiently and has good communication skills 
 

We review applications regularly, so don‚Äôt wait
We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. 
 
To make sure your personal data is safe, we don‚Äôt look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Daria Skucha, our Talent Acquisition Partner, at daria.skucha@assaabloy.com or Anders Hernodh, Director Cloud and Product IT Operations, at anders.hernodh@assaabloy.com .
 
We are the ASSA ABLOY Group
Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 50,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces ‚Äì physical and virtual ‚Äì safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results ‚Äì not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions ‚Äì supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it‚Äôs important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

headline: DevOps Engineer - Senior & Mid-level
description.text:
The Role

We are looking for a passionate DevOps Engineers who wants to take ownership of the infrastructure for our game server technology and help to develop this into our future platform. You will need to be able to work both as part of the team as well as independently. We strive for technical excellence and you will be required to venture outside of your comfort zone, learning, and implementing new technologies. You need to be able to take initiative and find creative solutions to complex problems.

We currently have opportunities for a senior and mid-level candidates and therefore we would like to hear from people at both levels of experience.



Responsibilities

- Build and maintain Docker / Kubernetes / Helm definitions.
- Manage Azure Kubernetes Service infrastructure.
- Create / maintain Azure DevOps based CI/CD pipeline for our upcoming game platform.
- Manage our resources (Clusters, Linux VMs, Databases, etc.) on Azure.
- Make sure our services are running around the clock. (Handle alerts)
- Use existing and new monitoring tools to keep the uptime of our systems.
- Build scripts to automate pipelines and processes.
- Work closely with server and game teams to build and support gaming products.
- Maintain and expand our infrastructure as code and configuration management toolset.






Essential requirements

- 5+ years (senior)/ 2+ years‚Äô experience (mid-level) with Azure cloud environments
- 5+ years (senior)/ 2+ years‚Äô experience (mid-level) with DevOps tools and release engineering
- Familiarity with infrastructure/pipeline as code and best practices
- Understanding/experience with web services, databases and relating infrastructure/architectures
- Scripting skills with PowerShell / Bash
- Understanding of networking concepts both on-premises and in the cloud, i.e. load balancers, Azure Application Gateways, WAF, DNS, subnets/vnets, etc.


What are we using?

- Docker / Kubernetes / Helm
- Azure
- Azure DevOps
- Application Insights
- Azure Table
- PostgreSQL
- Terraform
- Ansible




Good to have

- .NET Core
- Orleans
- SignalR


Personal traits

- Ability to take ownership of responsibilities
- Good interpersonal and team-work skills
- Open to feedback
- Collaborative and consensus-driven approach


About Ringtail Interactive



Ringtail Interactive is fast-growing technology start up working in the games industry with an overall goal of creating an unrivalled server solution to the market for use within small and medium sized enterprises. The team consists of a diverse group of experienced professionals from all around the world consistently pushing the boundaries of what is possible for a small development team. The company consists of two subsidiaries, Ringtail Games and Ringtail Technology.

Over the next year, we will be continuing to build the core of the team. Joining now will give you a chance to have a real impact on the company and the way in which the project develops.

headline: We¬¥re looking for a star in DevOps!
description.text:
If you want to be a Devops superstar ‚Äì this is the place to be!

Information about the position
As a DevOps engineer at Tietoevry Create, you will be part of the new Tietoevry, which in 2023 has a goal to grow in turnover and staff.

Tietoevry is one of the leading companies in the Nordics building digital services for our clients both in the private and public sectors. Tietoevry Create is looking to expand our DevOps team in Ume√• and are now looking for DevOps Engineers to boost their team.

This recruitment process is handled by Professionals Nord and Tietoevry¬¥s wish is that all questions about the service go to info@pn.se

The team
You will be part of a competent team that together has a lot of experience and knowledge. You¬¥ll get an opportunity to participate in many different projects and deliveries where you become part of the delivery team and work together towards different customers.

Tietoevrys DevOps Experts implement solutions for their customers, they are also involved in automation activities and effective usage and migrations to cloud platforms.

Tietoevrys goal is to increase the level of automation and increase speed and quality for their customers by implementing solutions using concepts like CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, Configuration as Code along with utilization of cloud platforms.

Work tasks/job assignments

 ‚Ä¢ Lead DevOps and Agile transformations for customers
 ‚Ä¢ Introducing Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Continuous Deployment and Test Automation concepts with the target of building a world-class automatic delivery pipeline
 ‚Ä¢ Providing automatic setup and efficient usage of cloud-based environments
 ‚Ä¢ Providing tools, frameworks, and processes that secure the quality of customer application
 ‚Ä¢ Suggesting optimizations and improvements to reduce lead times time and remove bottlenecks in product development

We are looking for
Candidates who have a drive to build a career in DevOps. Perhaps you have previously been a developer or worked with infrastructure where you encountered DevOps and automation (CI/CD/TA), which gave you¬†the drive and passion to develop into a DevOps expert.

We believe that your personal qualities are crucial to how well you will thrive in the role. You are a self-driven person who are interested in learning and adapting to new technology and trends.¬†For this role you need knowledge of Swedish and English. Furthermore, you have an automation and improvement mindset in all implementation work and are analytic and a problem solver.

START: Immediately
COVERAGE: Full-time
CITY: Ume√• or Sundsvall
SELECTION: Ongoing
CONTACT: Emelie

Apply for the position below by filling in your information and attaching documents. headline: DevOps Engineer for Ericsson Private 5G Development(717050)
description.text:
About this opportunity
Would you like to develop Ericsson Private 5G (EP5G) products and be part in driving our technology leadership?
 
Ericsson Private 5G (EP5G) is a high-performance, easy-to-use, and highly reliable cellular connectivity product that addresses the industrial market, including indoor and outdoor facilities of all sizes. Main features include high device density capacity, low latency, and powerful security protocols. We are now looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Platform Development team. In this position you will have a meaningful role in our EP5G DevOps team which has the full responsibility for developing and managing our live Cloud Environment. We apply lean and agile ways of working, hence continuous improvement, innovation, and collaboration are valued parts of the daily work. You will continuously encounter new challenges and get the opportunity to drive activities such as management of development and production environments including subsequent automation and feature development. This is supported by close cooperation with software development and customer support teams both locally and on other sites, as well as infrastructure service providers. We offer a stimulating work environment, vast competence development opportunities and possibilities to gain both professional as well as personal growth. Do you want to join us on this exciting journey? Don‚Äôt miss out on this opportunity in being part of a high performing team which are key in developing and rolling out EP5G on a fast growing and dynamic market.
 
What you will do
Develop and manage infrastructure and services, including deployment and management of development, test, staging and production environments
Administrate Public Cloud environment including Kubernetes clusters, monitoring services, VPN and networking orchestration as well as database management
Develop functionality supporting overall project infrastructure using Python and Go
Strive to increase and develop project automation, hence cater for CI/CD flow
Drive troubleshooting, root cause analysis, provide high quality support and advice to developers and customer support function, hence enable effective development environment and world class customer support
Drive continuous improvements and innovation of services and development processes

 
You will bring
A successful candidate is driven, has very good networking, collaboration, and interpersonal skills in English, both in written and oral form, a talent for innovation, and excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, covering:
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering, Computer Science or similar
Interest and experience of working with:
Public Cloud
Kubernetes
Monitoring services
VPN and networking
Infrastructure as code
Identification/Access management solutions
Security
Automation
Database management (such as SQL)
Linux
Eager to learn, curious, solution oriented as well as true standout colleague
Result oriented, having an innovative mentality and valuing high quality results
Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience within the field of DevOps and/or SW development is highly preferred

 
Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you¬¥ll have an outstanding opportunity! The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what¬¥s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world‚Äôs toughest problems. You¬¥ll be challenged, but you won‚Äôt be alone. You¬¥ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
 
What happens once you apply?
Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
 
Application:
Apply today and take the opportunity to join our team and become a key player in developing Ericsson‚Äôs future 5G private network products!
 
We look forward to receiving your application in English. Please note we cannot accept applications via email.
 
Primary location for this role: G√∂teborg, Sweden
For specific questions please contact Recruiter: Monika Jasinska monika.jasinska@ericsson.com
 
We welcome the opportunity to meet you!
 
 
Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.
Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || Sweden : V√§stra G√∂taland : G√∂teborg

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer, Command and Control North
description.text:
Since 1937 Saab is home to a dedicated and experienced group of people sharing the same belief; that it's a human right to feel safe.

 

In Lule√•, we find innovative and pioneering software solutions to complex problems which creates safety for people around the globe. We work closely together towards a common horizon and with passionate employees we are developing advanced mission management systems in both airborne and naval platforms.

 

Our collaborative agile teams have a clear goal - a mission and an ownership in making solutions in service to customers around the world, both today and in the future. With 80 software experts we are creating some of the most cutting-edge technologies and solutions in the defense industry. We are proud to say that our commitment is as exciting as our world-class capabilities and our location.

 

In Lule√•, Saab create code that matters. Join us and belong with a real sense of purpose.

 

Saab in Lule√• is in an expanding phase and now we are looking for someone who wants to be part of our DevOps team.

 

Your role

As a member of our DevOps team you will design and create solutions that will make our software development process fast, agile, secure and also assuring high quality deliveries. In order to build top of the line software solutions for our customers, we need to develop and improve how we can build and deliver our products in an efficient manner.

 

Your profile

You are a problem solver that likes variety and want to be part of the architecture and design. You also have a sense to try concepts and ideas hands on. You have an educational background in Computer Science, Computer engineering or equivalent work experience.

 

Example areas that you probably been in touch with:

 * Linux
 * Automation
 * Script (ex. Python, Bash, JS)
 * Java
 * Gradle
 * Bitbucket
 * Git
 * Jenkins

 

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

 

What you will be part of

Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 19,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer, more sustainable and more equitable world. Read more about us here: https://www.saab.com/about

 

Business area Surveillance offers world-leading sensor technology in monitoring and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio covers airborne, ground-based and naval radar, electronic warfare, C4I solutions, aviation systems and cyber security.

 

Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement, you can send us your application in either Swedish or English.

 

Contact information to recruiting manager:

Patrik Boman, patrik.boman@saabgroup.com

+46 734 46 00 76

 

Saab is a company with a strong people-orientation. We offer a friendly work environment where we support and help each other to be at our best. Continuous learning, career & talent development and employee well-being are examples of areas where we always put the strongest effort to offer great opportunities.

headline: DevOps Engineer with Linux experience, Air traffic Management
description.text:
Join our creative and international environment to help us shape the future of air-traffic management systems, and offer efficient delivery of integrated software systems to airport control towers around the world.

 

Your Role

The IATS (integrated air-traffic control suite) department develops and delivers complex, customised software for civil aviation, as part of the ATM tower systems business unit.

We are currently undergoing organizational change, and moving from extremely Waterfall processes to a more agile approach with automated testing, continuous integration and continuous delivery.

The IATS DevOps team:

Our aim is to apply software engineering principles, and modern methods found in the wider community, to the process of building, releasing, and deploying IATS software and configuration.

The team's responsibilities cover:

1. Designing, developing, and maintaining IATS development & build infrastructure (internal systems and tools)

2. Designing and implementing the IATS deployment subsystem (delivered as part of the product)

3. Helping to improve our delivery processes and tools (the bridge between 1 and 2)

 

What we work with:

 * 

Linux systems (Red Hat and Debian derivatives)
 * 

Software tools and services, mostly written in Python and Bash
 * 

The IATS software itself, written in C++. This is ultimately the responsibility of component maintainers
 * 

Software version control with Git, Subversion
 * 

Build pipelines, currently implemented with Jenkins, Maven, Artifactory
 * 

Software packaging (RPM, deb)
 * 

Virtualisation, virtual machine management, containers
 * 

Improving automation and refactoring existing tools to give us continuous integration and continuous delivery. Doing it right
 * 

IP network design, implementation, and debugging (incl. Ethernet, VLANs, IPv4, IPv6, multicast, TCP, UDP)
 * 

Switch configuration (Cisco, Juniper)
 * 

Network services (incl. iSCSI, DHCP, TFTP, DNS, NTP, SNMP, SSH, HTTP, HTTPS)
 * 

Information security (incl. OS hardening, file system permissions, TLS, public key certificates, digital signatures, cryptographic hashing)

 

DevOps Engineer responsibilities

 * 

Design, development, and testing of small-to-medium-scale software programs
 * 

Linux systems administration, automation, integration (with a DevOps / SRE approach)
 * 

Some hardware maintenance and troubleshooting
 * 

Monitoring (hardware, network, software) and analysis

 

Your profile

To succeed in this role you need to have a MSc in Computer Science or a related subject, or equivalent experience, along with appropriate expertise in Linux systems. The ability to communicate clearly and proficiently in English, both written and spoken are necessary.

An interest in civil aviation is a plus, but we can help you with that!

Experience from leading a team would be considered a merit.

 

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

 

What you will be part of

Welcome to a workplace with inspiring challenges where the meeting between competence and personality builds the foundation for our success. We look forward to your application as soon as possible!

 

If you are interested in what benefits you can take part of as an employee at Saab in Sweden, you can read more about them here

 

Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 19,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer, more sustainable and more equitable world. Read more about us here.

 

Business area Surveillance offers world-leading sensor technology in monitoring and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio covers airborne, ground-based and naval radar, electronic warfare, C4I solutions, aviation systems and cyber security.

 

Saab is a company with a strong people-orientation. We offer a friendly work environment where we support and help each other to be at our best. Continuous learning, career & talent development and employee well-being are examples of areas where we always put the strongest effort to offer great opportunities.

headline: DevOps Engineer? Use your skills to fight cancer!
description.text:
RaySearch develops innovative software solutions to improve cancer care. Over 800 clinics in more than 40 countries use RaySearch software to improve treatments and quality of life for patients. RaySearch was founded in 2000 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. The headquarters is located in Stockholm, with subsidiaries in the US, Europe, Asia and Australia & New Zealand. Today we are more than 380 employees with a common vision of improving cancer care with innovative software. Our great staff is crucial for our success and we offer a fantastic working environment in modern offices, flexibility and good opportunities for development. We believe in equal opportunities, value diversity and work actively to prevent discrimination.

Do you have experience of Configuration Management/DevOps? Joining RaySearch, you will be part of creating innovative software for cancer treatment! Use your skills to make a difference. 

About the job

RayStation is a flexible, innovative treatment planning system chosen by many of the leading cancer centers worldwide. The system is developed by a dozen agile teams with expertise in, for example, treatments with linear accelerators, proton machines and image processing. We develop our products in close collaboration with leading cancer clinics. 

As DevOps Engineer you will become part of a smaller team within RayStation product development. You will cooperate closely with developers and project management within the project, as well as with the DevOps Engineers for our other products. The configuration teams are growing, and together you will have great opportunity to create and develop working routines and ways of cooperation. 

Your main tasks: 

‚Ä¢ Manage the build and release flows 
‚Ä¢ Manage build and test servers and the related environments 
‚Ä¢ Manage work item templates in Azure DevOps 
‚Ä¢ Manage tools using the Azure DevOps REST API to input and output information 
‚Ä¢ Administer, manage and provide support for Git version control 
‚Ä¢ Strive to make the development iteration times short and efficient 

Your profile:

Do you have a technical background who want to be part of agile development? Do you enjoy working in a growing company where task and goals continuously change? If the answer is yes, this could maybe be a role for you. 

Since communicating and collaborating with different teams is an important part of this role it is important that you enjoy a social workday and appreciate helping others. We think that you are a self-motivated person with a positive attitude. We also believe that you are a person who do not miss any relevant details. Instead, what you do, is solving problems and prioritizing in an efficient way. We welcome both English and Swedish speaking persons, already living in Stockholm is an advantage since we want to fill the position as soon as possible. 

Experience & skills:

‚Ä¢ B.Sc. or M. Sc. in engineering or equivalent experience 
‚Ä¢ +5 years‚Äô experience of continuous integration and deployment (Senior role) 
‚Ä¢ +1 years‚Äô experience of continuous integration and deployment (Junior role) 
‚Ä¢ +5 years' experience in build and release management (Senior role) 
‚Ä¢ +1 years' experience in build and release management (Junior role) 
‚Ä¢ Experience of PowerShell 
‚Ä¢ Experience of Windows Server administration/management 
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills in Swedish and/or English 

You probably also have experience of Azure DevOps or other configuration management. 

Working with us

Our headquarters in Stockholm are the heart of our growing R&D department with 19050 of the industry's most skillful engineers, developers, researchers, machine learning experts and physicists. We believe that it‚Äôs crucial that our employees love what they do for us to keep growing. We encourage a healthy work-life balance because we know that‚Äôs the only way to long-term success. We believe in investing in our people and offer great staff benefits, a modern office environment, flexible hours and regular afterwork and activities. 

Application

You are welcome to send your application in Swedish or English by the application form below. The selection and interviewing process will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by e-mail but if you have any questions regarding the position please contact Helena Holmqvist, Project Manager Development.

headline: Hedin IT is looking for a DevOps Specialist
description.text:
The automotive industry is changing rapidly, where digitalization is pushing a drastic change in purchasing behaviours. Hedin Group continues to grow in Sweden as well as in Europe, and to maintain our strong position on the market, Hedin IT strive to offer the best digital customer experience. We are now looking for our first DevOps Specialist to join our team.

You're probably wondering what a day at work looks like..

 let us tell you! As our first Devops Specialist you will bridge the gap between our development teams and operations. You will set new standards, monitor, run our terraforms and manage alarms, which also means that you will be an important part of our infrastructure security. You will work in the Operations team and collaborate with our developer teams. Furthermore, you will work closely with our Service Delivery Manager to develop and follow up on our KPIs.

You will also:

- Automate and improve development and release processes

- Lead and coach our DevOps culture

- Focus on safety-enhancing activities, automation and quality

- Work with implementations, configurations and CI/CD solutions

Who are you?

To thrive as a DevOps Specialist at Hedin IT, we believe that you are structured and driven. You have a few years of experience of Devops and are fluent in English, in both spoken and written language. It‚Äôs also a plus if you speak Swedish.

We believe that you have experience with:

- CI/CD pipelines

- Kubernetes

- Terraform

- Azure DevOps

If you also have experience with Argo CD and Kustomize for auto deploy of apps and/or Helm for the installation of middleware, we see it as a big plus.

About Hedin IT
Hedin IT was founded in 2018 in Gothenburg, Sweden, with the mission to support the entire Hedin Group with digital skills and services. This includes everything from support and operations to system development. Our services are delivered in Sweden, Germany, Norway, Switzerland, Germany, Netherlands and Belgium. The group consists of approximately 8000 employees and had 3.3 billion Euro in revenue 2021.

Apply today!
Interviews are held continuously for this position. You are welcome to contact Erika Thorslund, at +46 72 080 75 06 or at erika.thorslund@hedinit.se (mailto:linn.forsberg@hedinit.se) if you have any questions.

headline: DevOps Engineer with passion for CI, Build-and Test environment
description.text:
If you enjoy working in a creative environment and finding solutions to problems by working together with skilled teams, this is the place for you! We develop software for advanced military command and control systems. Our goal is to be even better to produce software by using DevOps

 

 

Your role

You will be a part of an agile team where you have great opportunities to influence both products and working methods. The share of software is increasing in our products, with a need of shorter lead times and feedback loops. We hope that you will be one of our future key players on this journey.

Briefly, your tasks will be:

 * 

Creating an automated framework for CI/CD that would support our cross functional teams to integrate and test their software faster and improve their efficiency
 * 

Building automated tests frameworks within DevOps environment
 * 

Support our tech organization in the DevOps area with best practices and training
 * 

Specification and development of application software

 

Your profile

You are a software developer with preferable some years of experience working with CI-pipelines. Your interests are in software development automation and testing. Solving and simplify complex problem feels natural and also spreading that knowledge. You enjoy working in a structured and accurate way, and like to cooperate with other developers within and outside the teams.

Required skills/experience:

 * 

Experience from software development in Java
 * 

Ability to work team oriented as well as independent
 * 

Good communication skills in speaking and writing (Swedish and English)
 * 

Bachelor's degree from Science/Engineering/Technology within computer science, engineering physics or equivalent
 * 

Linux knowledge

 

Good-to-have skills/experience:

 * 

Experience of working with CI-pipeline
 * 

DevOps, e.g. Jenkins pipelines
 * 

Git/Bitbucket
 * 

Artifactory/repository management
 * 

Container technology, e.g. Dockers
 * 

Container orchestering (tex kubernetes)
 * 

Gradle
 * 

JavaScript
 * 

Agile ways of working

 

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

 

 

What you will be a part of

Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe.

Empowered by its 18,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer, more sustainable and more equitable world.

 

Business area Surveillance offers world-leading sensor technology in monitoring and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio covers airborne, ground-based and naval radar, electronic warfare, C4I solutions, aviation systems and cyber security.

 

You will be part of the development of command, control and communication systems for our radars used in the ground base air defence domain. The department consists of approximately 60 employees and consultants and we plan to grow. We have the whole chain of competences from demand to delivery within our department.

headline: DevOps/CI Software Developer
description.text:
We're running an exciting mission. The mission developing the Android Infotainment Platform for current and upcoming Volvo, Polestar and other Geely brand cars.

More about us (https://www.haleytek.com/about-us)

Are you the Software Integration Specialist we are looking for? You have proven experience from software development in larger contexts and now you have found out how stimulating it is to utilize your experiences to improve for other developers.

You and your skills

You are a true developer who is motivated by challenging tasks, have a personal interest in technology and will be a key person in building and improving our CI/CD environment as well as coaching and spreading a DevOps culture in our development teams. You like to see the whole picture and have an overall understanding of the complete system, you have worked with complex integration processes in a multi team environment.

You will be part of an experienced team, developing and operating the full-stack of our CI-machinery all the way from infrastructure, build-systems, automation, data-analysis and visualization. In our work we are involving multiple technologies and tools: Python, Gerrit, Git, Cloud/Azure, SSO, Kubernetes, OnPrem, Linux, Ansible, Terraform, PostgreSQL, Prometheus, Grafana, Typescript, ReactJS, and Docker.

Our culture

As a flat organization we build an accountable culture that enables the teams to influence, and makes quick decisions and actions possible. Everyone is willing and able to pitch in and do hands on jobs when needed. In line with this, you will also have the opportunity to influence the development of this role.

We are a professional, energetic and friendly team, working in a modern office at the waterfront of Lindholmen, G√∂teborg. Our developers are working with cutting edge equipment and advanced hi-tech computers. We offer competitive benefits, such as maximum taxfree fitness allowance.

If you believe that work should be fun and that a workplace should be defined by inclusion, diversity and an open-minded, ‚Äòin it together‚Äô mentality

Come and join us on our journey! Become a HaleyTek:er!




Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications and CV's sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

headline: Java Cloud SW Developer - Gothenburg
description.text:
Veritaz is a fast-growing IT-consultant firm. Our company is made up of insanely bright people from over 4 countries, and we are located in Sweden, UK, US and Pakistan. The voyage has been incredible this far, but it is only the beginning.
Assignment Description:
We are looking for a Java Cloud SW Developer who is experienced in handling car-related information to the cloud, to cars, to mobile apps and to partners.
Do you value openness, transparency, and empowerment? Our squad is high performing cross-functional team who are set with a mission to provide win-win exchanges for our customers.
What you'll do:
‚óè       Define, build, test and deploy highly secure applications serving connected cars and their users.
‚óè       Collaborate with Product Owner to ensure the right functionality is being developed and estimate the size and complexity of the work to be able to plan upcoming sprints.
‚óè       Determine and maintain the technical design in our area within the given architectural guidelines.
‚óè       Collaborate with the rest of the project members and the engagement manager to design and launch new features.
‚óè       Responsible for implementing, testing and operating our services, so we also have our hands on packaging our services and setting our pipelines.
Who you are:
‚óè       Have experience with IoC (e.g., Spring), DevOps, test automation and system monitoring, and technologies such as Kubernetes, Kafka, Cassandra, REST and JMS/AMQP.
‚óè       Good understanding in agile development methodology principles (e.g., SAFe, Scrum, Lean, Kanban) and have worked in product teams.
‚óè       Have expert level knowledge of Java Service integration with Web Services, REST/SOAP, and microservices-based frameworks.
‚óè       Excellent communication and mentoring skills and can write and speak in English.
‚óè       Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency.

Du kommer tillsammans med dina kollegor ansvara f√∂r IT-drift och utveckling utav v√•r mest moderna teknikstack som idag best√•r av ett stort antal komponenter s√•som Redhat Openshift, CEPH, Ansible och ArgoCD.

headline: Supply Chain Analyst
description.text:
Are you a curious analyst who appreciates the importance of collaborative development in a global environment? Are you passionate about delivering excellent customer service and business performance - utilizing digital technologies and insights based on data? Then you might be just the one we are looking for to join our team in Dealer Inventory Management. 


 WHO ARE WE? 


The Dealer Inventory Management Analyst team is a diverse team of innovative colleagues from 10 different nationalities across the globe mainly gathered close to the sea in Gothenburg. Collaboration and transparent communication is key for us. With daily stand ups and weekly sharing slots in the team we cherish a supportive environment where we all learn and grow together.  Now is a great time to join us since we are on an exciting journey to transform the way we plan towards a data driven, visualized service market supply chain working with agile business driven development in DevOps teams. 


Learn more about who we are at‚ÄØVolvo Group Service Market Logistics‚ÄØon YouTube. 
 
WHAT DO WE DO? 
 
You will be part of our EMEA & APAC team securing an optimized steering of spare parts to our 4000 dealers around the globe through an automated inventory concept. You will have a broad role working with optimizing and visualizing our supply chain with the end goal of balancing end customer availability of spare parts at out dealerships with the total supply chain cost. In the scope of the DIM Analyst EMEA & APAC team we take care of the dealer spare part inventory for Volvo Penta, Volvo Trucks, Volvo Bus, Renault Trucks and Volvo Construction Equipment. 


In parallel to our operational scope we are right now focused in two main projects. The first one is to move all current reporting and visualization into three major Power Bi applications for all stakeholders - including our 4000 dealers. The second project is the rolling out of PlanIT ‚Äì a cloud native planning solution allowing agile software development to drive the continuous improvement of supply chain planning capabilities. 


In DIM Analysis EMEA & APAC, you will have the opportunity to really make a difference for the future together with supporting colleagues in a highly international and skilled team.  


 You can learn more about Volvo Group DIM concept on YouTube. 


 WHO ARE YOU? 
A true team player with a curious mindset 
Proficiency in 1 or more scripting languages (SQL, Python, Spark, QlikView, Java, etc.)  
Skilled in data analytics and able to tell a story based on data 
A self-starter who welcomes problems 
Capable of understanding a global, ever-changing supply chain 
Comfortable to leave well-trodden paths and engage cross functionally 
Able to manage deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced environment  
Knowledge of Agile methodology, Microsoft Azure, DevOPs, or software development 

CURIOUS? 
 
Curious to know more about the job, your future colleagues or upcoming explorations, don't hesitate to reach out. 
If you are interested to join our journey, send in your application today! 
 
Hiring Manager: Lina Liljenberg, lina.liljenberg@volvo.com


Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.

headline: Junior tester to market leading company within auditing
description.text:
If you are motivated by solving problems and ensure that projects and tasks are being solved in the best possible way, then this is the role for you! We are now looking for a junior tester who is eager to develop and learn more within testing and quality assurance. You will be part of a team full of knowledge and experience at a company that encourages an internal career. If this sounds like your next job - don't hesitate and submit your application today!

OM TJ√ÑNSTEN 
We are now looking for an driven junior tester on behalf of our client for a long-term assignment. Our client is the market leader in Sweden in auditing, accounting and consulting with 50,000 clients all over Sweden. Their vision is a well-functioning, sustainable business and society that inspires trust. Here, knowledge is central and the employees' knowledge, expertise and experience are highly valued. They are driven by their ingenuity, expertise and the latest technology to create added value for their customers.

Our clients IT department is growing and they are now looking for their next talented colleague! As a member of their team, you will be given the opportunity to be innovative and make a big difference while ensuring high quality in their products and processes.

#

You are offered


* Working with engaged and passionate team members
* A workplace with great opportunities to grow within your role, and where internal careers are encouraged
* Flexible working hours and the possibility to work partly remote


As a consultant at Academic Work you are offered a great opportunity to grow as a professional, extend your network and establish valuable contacts for the future. Read more aboutour offer.

ARBETSUPPGIFTER 
You will work together with the developers and strive to find the most effective solutions together, and be involved in solutions to making their product reach an even higher quality level through continous and thourough testing.

Some of your daily task will be:


* Quality assurance together with the developers
* Manual testing
* Being a part of the ongoing work with automated testing, with the possibility over time to develop and work more with automation


VI S√ñKER DIG SOM 
- Have a relevant education within IT
- Have knowledge and/or some experience with manual testing
- Have knowledge and/or some experience in C#
- Some experience in Azure DevOps and CI/CD pipelines
- Used to an Agile workflow
- Fluent in English, both written and spoken language

Being fluent in Swedish is not a requirement, but since our client's main company language is Swedish we consider knowledge in Swedish as a meritorious skill, and it's important that you're willing to learn.

As a person you are:


* A great problem solver
* Structured and thorough
* Communicative and high cooperative skills


#

Other information


* Start: April/May
* Work extent: Full time
* Location: Vasastaden, Stockholm. You will also have the possibility to work partly remote, if you prefer that.


This recruitment process is conducted by Academic Work. It is a request from our client that all questions regarding the position is handled byAcademic Work. Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase.

headline: Software Developer - Stockholm

‚óè       Continually update technical knowledge and skills by attending in-house and external courses, reading manuals, and accessing new applications.

‚óè       Excellent communication, teamwork skills, inter-personal and Organizational skills.

headline: Data Developer (Splunk/Ansible/DevOps)
description.text:
Join the Data Tribe
Are you a self-driven individual who loves developing and engineering data tools, products and services together with likeminded people? Then the Data Tribe might be the right place for you! We are an autonomous team who thrive on making good use out of technology to enable our customers to take smarter decisions based on data - while enjoying the ride together!

The foundation of our toolset have been Splunk for years, and many of us originally started our journey with that technology as customers. Now as a team of senior ninjas within the leading Splunk Partner, we thrive in making our customers derive more value out of their data by improving all different aspects of both management and utilization of it within their businesses. Historically the Data Tribe has done this as specialist consultants out in the field, and while this remains a core part of the business our focus have shifted into developing tools, products and services based on our niche skills and experience to scale up our impact and reach far beyond any individual have.

This means our toolbox have grown to take advantage of other types of technologies like Ansible, Git, Python and the plethora of cloud infrastructure and services to revamp the way we interact with all aspects of Splunk. A good example of this is  CCA for Splunk (https://github.com/innovationfleet/cca_for_splunk), which we released as open-source earlier this year, that totally transform the lifecycle management of Splunk by effectively disassociate scale & complexity from effort.

We are however just ramping up and are now looking for additional talent to join us in our journey of creating the next generation of powerful, scalable and highly valuable data solution. Does this sounds exciting to be part of then please read on!



About you
Rather than being a cog in a huge machinery, you are the kind of person who likes to build, break and improve the toolset and make the machine work for you. You¬¥re never bored in a setting where the opportunities are endless - and they sure are when working with data solutions that span the full spectrum from strategy to end user experience. You have a broad technical understanding and demonstratable experience of making data valuable. You like the idea of working within a team full of highly motivated individuals that have a diverse skillset and strengths that complement each other. While you may not check all the boxes, you definitely bring your own weight to the table with an open heart and mind, a can-do attitude and a will to grow together.



Technologies
Splunk - experience from running an enterprise grade platform and the importance of an efficient Admin/Architecture are highly valuable. You know that a fundamental key to leverage data effectively is the data platform itself. The other part of the equation brings meaning to the first, and you have an excellent ability to ask questions on data and represent the results in meaningful ways, especially through the Observability Suite's ITSI and through creative use of the API/SDK. Similar relevant solutions like ELK/LogPoint/Datadog and other query based time-series data platforms are also beneficial. We <3 ninjas who knows how to make data valuable!

Ansible/Terraform - experience in automation, especially in relation to Splunk, is key to success at scale. You like to automate everything you can to reach better efficiency and consistency, and know that¬¥s the only way to approach the complexity without sacrificing either speed or security at scale. Skills in similar relevant solutions like Puppet/Chef are also transferable. Automation is the #1 boredom slayer.

DevSecOps toolset - experience in all kinds of scenarios but especially in GitOps/CDCI context, where you know that a correctly implemented pipeline creates opportunities by involving everyone in the build/test/deploy processes. You¬¥re accustomed in using tech like Python/React/Java to close gaps presented in the technology stack of data providers/consumers or to enhance the end user experience. There¬¥s nothing a smart script can¬¥t fix!



Experience
DevOps/SRE - accountability is a given for you; a you-build-it-you-support-it kind of approach makes for a good foundational environment where you develop, delivering and support together. Taking responsibility builds respect and trust with both peers and customers and provides freedom to explore the next big thing instead of putting out yesterdays fires.

Observability/Operational Intelligence - you got a deep understanding of the fundamental methods to capture the operational state, troubleshoot and find insights based on logs, metrics and traces. Performant tech is essential to any core business, and you know that if it can¬¥t be measured, it doesn¬¥t matter in practice.

Software Development - full stack or not, you know all parts have their place in creating smart solutions and with a good track record in building cool things with interesting technology you¬¥re seldom alone. Perhaps your expertise lies in developing APIs or in utilizing them in in creating responsive UX designs?

Agile culture - you¬¥re well accustomed to working with high degrees of freedom under responsibility, perhaps even in a Product development team running fully blown Scrum or as a member in a small team utilizing Kanban to organize your work? You enjoy both the social and the productive aspects standups before taking the day on and draw strength from retrospect's after successful launches and feedback sessions when somethings gone wrong, learning from mistakes.

Consultancy - implemented in the proper sense of the word - provide competence and advice - you know this is a fantastic opportunity to aid customers in their line of work,  as well as it provides great input to the development process as it reveals actual real pains that needs to be solved.

Entrepreneurship - you often find yourself in situations where you not only come up with great ideas but builds on others, and instead of ending up in the could-have-been-graveyard you take the initiative in exploring them! Perhaps some of them have ended up as as a new feature, a new product or sparked a side hustle? An while not everything pans out, you learn from the experience and move on - the next killer app ain¬¥t going to create it self!

About the role
We are a small but highly dynamic team, where versatility and curiosity is a given - whatever comes your way you figure it out one way or another. W...

headline: Team focused System Administrator in Uppsala
description.text:
Are you looking for a meaningful work with an employer who has a strong team focus? Are you a Sysadmin who are interested in cloud technologies, that thrives in a structured environment and likes development? In that case, we would like to have digital coffee with you as soon as possible!

Uppstuk is now looking for a System Administrator to an independent, non-profit organisation that works with international IT-services and scientific research. The foundation is based in Uppsala and is a world leader in promoting safer use of medicines globally. The foundation is now in need of an addition to one of their teams.

We are looking for a Sysadmin who wants to be part of the development journey we are facing. Along this journey, parts of the sysadmin tasks will evolve and change as we move our server operations from a managed server service to a hybrid cloud solution. We are therefore looking for someone who is curious and already has started to acquire new skills or who has realized, -and is looking forward to- the need to further develop your skills in the future.

The team you will be part of is therefore facing several changes in the coming years. To fit in, we think you like development and new ideas.

Today, the system administrator is responsible for:

- The internal helpdesk (IT support to employees) - the Digital Workplace

- Hardware

- Office365 and all office applications

- Support/development of Office365 in the form of Teams admin, automated processes for HR for on/offboarding, administration of our SharePoint.

- Monitoring of the external and internal IT services.

- Support in procurement of applications e.g., CRM and configuring these for the needs of the business

Our goal for the future is that the team will work close with our DevOps teams, which will include:

- Infrastructure as Code - IaC - a lot that we did manually will now be automated with e.g. Powershell script or similar.

- The DW (Digital Workplace) team will support our DevOps teams with the setup and maintenance of our infrastructure and services in our hybrid cloud.

- Application teams monitor "their own" applications

- The DW team monitors common services and infrastructure services (you will be part of this team)

Therefore, it is the best match, and you will thrive best, if you are interested in cloud technologies (specifically Azure) but also, of course, are a service-minded person who likes to support your colleagues.

To thrive, perform and develop in this role, we are looking for someone who has expertise in:

- Microsoft Azure - automated configuration and monitoring of infrastructure services

- Windows - client management in the form of PC support and automation of device management e.g. with Windows Autopilot. Have experience with MS Defender and Intune.

- Office 365 - e.g. Exchange Online, Sharepoint, Teams.

In addition, you need to have a good sense of order and be able to organise your own work effectively and also to support others in structuring. Although there are parallel tasks, it is important to be able to finish and deliver before taking on new tasks.

You will work with many different types of people which provides a good energy and variety, it also sets the requirement that you appreciate, are able to, and find it stimulating to communicate with different types of people.

Sound interesting?

The position is full-time, start date to be agreed upon. You will be employed directly by the foundation, but Uppstuk will handle the recruitment process. The foundation wants the position to be filled as soon as possible so do not hesitate to send your application today! Interviews will be held over video link in the context of Covid-19.

We warmly welcome your application! We are filling the position on a rolling basis, so apply today!

At Uppstuk, we put you as an employee first, creating an understanding of what drives you and matching you with your dream job!

Unfortunately, due to GDPR, we do not accept applications by email.
